metafields.title: Website Blurb

metafields.value:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: Florida’s 27th District
Primary Date: 08/28/2018
Primary Type:  Closed

"I want to serve Florida's 27th to give voice to the under-served communities in South Florida. I want to empower our communities with high quality educational opportunities, resilient safe neighborhoods, and put every chance at a brighter future that I was given within the reach of all working families." - Michael Hepburn

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Michael fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people he would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting to:

  • Create Universal Pre-K to Tuition Free Public Higher Education
  • Build a 21st century economy fueled by Living Wage Jobs and resilient communities
  • Provide Medicare for All – NO Co-pays, ZERO Deductibles, vision coverage included 
  • Increase and expanding Social Security Benefits
  • Invest in major Infrastructure Development and improvements to our Mass Transit Systems
  • End mass incarceration and the War on Drugs
  • Implement life saving Gun Control Reform

Michael Hepburn is a young bold progressive Democrat and community leader that is running to become your U.S. Congressman. He’s a former Senior Advisor for the University of Miami Business School; Fortune 500 Executive; and Blue Chip for the National Football League. When he’s not campaigning – you can find him serving in our community as a mentor to our youth; or leading his neighborhood association meetings; and even patrolling our streets as a volunteer C.O.P. with the Miami Police Department. He is a champion for education, healthcare, and economic justice for all of us. Michael doesn’t accept big money from corporations and lobbyists so he's free to stand up and fight for working class and normal people like us. His perspective and real-world experience makes him exactly the sort of Congressman we need in Washington. 

”I am not the manufactured candidate who normally gets recruited to run for public office… However, I can tell you first-hand as a Bahamian African-American, Millennial, Democrat – there’s definitely a path to victory here and our candidacy for Congress will be history making but I need your help. ” - Michael Hepburn

Help us spread the message about Michael’s mission to bring real change to Florida’s 27th District and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Michael’s story, click or tap here.
metafields.title: Calling Prompt

metafields.value:
Michael Hepburn Phone Banking Script

Introduction:

Hello, may I speak to __________?  

Hi ________, My name is _________ and I’m a volunteer with the Hepburn For Congress Campaign.How are you doing today? (acknowledge response and respond depending on their answer). 

We wanted to give you a quick call to find out if you heard the great news about Michael Hepburn? 

If NO: No worries! I would love to introduce him to you! Michael Hepburn is a young bold progressive Democrat and community leader that is running to become your U.S. Congressman. He’s a former Senior Advisor for the University of Miami Business School and Blue Chip for the National Football League. When he’s not campaigning – you can find him serving in our community as a Mentor to our youth; or leading his neighborhood association meetings.  

Michael is for _______ (pick two or three from list below)

  • Creating Universal Pre-K to Tuition Free Public Higher Education.
  • Building a 21st century economy fueled by Living Wage Jobs and resilient communities
  • Providing Medicare for All – I’m talking NO Co-pays, ZERO Deductibles, vision coverage included
  • Increasing and expanding Social Security Benefits
  • Investing in major Infrastructure Development and improvements to our Mass Transit Systems – especially here in South Dade

If YES: That’s great!  Then you already know that Michael is a young bold progressive Democrat, community leader and former Senior Advisor for the University of Miami Business School – that’s fighting for... (pick two or three from list below)

  • Creating Universal Pre-K to Tuition Free Public Higher Education.
  • Building a 21st century economy fueled by Living Wage Jobs and resilient communities
  • Providing Medicare for All – I’m talking NO Co-pays, ZERO Deductibles, vision coverage included
  • Increasing and expanding Social Security Benefits
  • Investing in major Infrastructure Development and improvements to our Mass Transit Systems – especially here in South Dade

Can Michael count on your support and vote in the upcoming Democratic Primary on August 28th?

(click on result to jump to the next script section)

1 - STRONG Hepburn
2 - LEAN Hepburn
3 - UNDECIDED
4 - LEAN Opponent
 5 - STRONG Opponent
6 - LEAN Other
7 - STRONG Other
8 - NOT VOTING

Support 1 - 2

That's great! We’re working hard every day to spread the message about Michael’s mission to bring a New Perspective to South Florida and our nation. With only a few months left to organize, we need as much help as possible. Are you available to help knock on doors or make calls to voters just like I am doing right now?

If YES, can volunteer:  Awesome! Let's get you signed up and get you on our email list and someone will reach out to you soon about opportunities with the campaign: (click button below and sign them up))

If NO, can't volunteer: Alright - if you find time in the future, please visit michaelhepburn.com to get involved. You can also see everything we are doing on our Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. (move on to the next question…)

Can I send you a text with links to our website or social media so you can give us a like or follow? We want you to stay updated with the campaign!

If YES: Great! (Click on button below and fill out form for them)

If NO:  (Move on to next part…)

Thank you for your time and support for Michael - we look forward to having you join us soon, [voter name].

Undecided/Lean Opponent 3 - 4

It’s alright, we're going to try to earn your support over the next couple of months – as you get to know Michael better and what he stands for…

Personally, I support Michael because _____________

EXAMPLE:

I’m looking for someone who values hard work, someone who doesn’t accept big money from corporations and lobbyist – so when they get to office they won’t owe any favors, and someone who will stand up and fight for working class and normal people like me. Michael is not an aspiring career politician or millionaire. His perspective and real-world experience makes him exactly the sort of Congressman we need in Washington.

Do you want me to send you a text with links to Michael’s website or social media so you can find out more information? 

If YES:  (click on button below and fill out form for them)

If NO: No worries. You can see more about Michael’s plans and the importance of this campaign on our website at michaelhepburn.com

Thank you for your time, we hope Michael can win your support.

DO NOT Support 5 - 6 - 7 - 8

Thank you for your time, [voter name], we hope Michael Hepburn can win your support in the future!

metafields.value: As a scientist, activist, and single mother, Roza Calderon knows that we need leaders who represent real people’s needs over party interests. That means combatting climate change, fighting for Medicare for All, and building an inclusive economy--not because it’s popular, because it’s the right thing to do for California’s 4th District.
metafields.title: Website Blurb

metafields.value:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: California, 4th
Primary Date: 06/05/2018
Primary Type:  Top-Two Primary
Voter Registration Deadline: 05/21/2018

”Politics have been at the forefront of my life. Living in the US and the opportunities that I was afforded have not been taken for granted. The great thing about this country, is that we do not have to sit idle and let our government silence us. It is the job of our public officers to look out for the people. ” - Roza Calderon

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Roza Calderon fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people she would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting to:

  • Invest in rural America & rebuild American industry 
  • Single-payer healthcare through Medicare for all
  • Fight for equity in our K-12 system – it’s our nation’s foundation
  • Cut taxes for middle and lower income Americans
  • Defend our natural resources & protect our environment
  • Get money out of politics to ensure representation
  • Offer tuition-free education to qualified students at all public colleges & trade schools
  • Secure roadmap to citizenship and implement an employment verification system

Roza Calderon — a Progressive Democrat, California Congressional District 4 Candidate, Co-Founder of Placer Women Democrats, and Co-Founder of Indivisible Citizens of California’s 4th Congressional District, Co-Founder of California Dreamers — has been involved with the local community and politically engaged in the region for over 10 years. We need a leader with experience with their people and courage, who will do the right thing for the constituents of California’s 4th Congressional District. We need a candidate like Roza who will fight for you and always work and vote alongside the people, not the party.

”Access to quality healthcare is a human right. It is our moral obligation to make it truly affordable to all Americans. The road to freedom from corporate stronghold lies in Medicare expansion for all.” - Roza Calderon

Help us spread the message about Roza Calderon’s mission to bring real change to California and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Rosa Calderon’s story, click or tap here.
metafields.title: Calling Prompt

metafields.value:
Roza Calderon Phone Banking Script

Hi, is _________ available?

My name is __________________ I’m a volunteer with Roza Calderon who is running for Congress.

As a geoscientist, activist, and refugee from El Salvador, Roza is a true believer in the American Dream, and knows that we need leaders who represent real people’s needs over party interests to make sure that everyone has an opportunity for upward mobility. Roza is determined to be the voice for the working class and work to rebuild our disappearing middle class. In Congress she will be fighting for the heart of this nation: the people. That means combating climate change, fighting for Medicare for All, and building an inclusive economy - not because it’s popular, because it’s the right thing to do for California’s 4th District and for America.

Could Roza count on your vote in the California Democratic Primary on June 5th?

(click on result to jump to the next script section)

1 - STRONG Calderon
2 - LEAN Calderon
3 - UNDECIDED
4 - LEAN Opponent
 5 - STRONG Opponent
6 - LEAN Other
7 - STRONG Other
8 - NOT VOTING

Support 1 - 2

That’s great! We are on the same page. We are working hard to spread the message about Roza’s mission to bring real change to California’s 4th District and to America. With only a few months left to organize, we need as much help as possible.

Would you be willing to make phone banking calls from home for Roza Calderon just like what I’m doing now? Or host a house-party? We will provide you guides, training, and live support to make sure you have a great experience and make a real difference in these congressional races, no matter your location or ability.

If YES can make calls: Awesome! Let me sign you up for an upcoming call shift! (go to jdems.us/call and sign them up for a call shift!). 

Depending on your availability, you will select your available date(s), fill out this form with your information, and be sent a reminder before your scheduled call time via email and text message. A member from our dialer team will give you a call and make sure you feel ready. 

If YES can host house party: If YES to house party: Awesome! Let me sign you up and our Field Director will contact you! (go to bit.ly/housepartyroza and sign them up).

If NO cannot volunteer: It’s alright - if you find time in the future, please visit electroza.org to get involved. Our list of supporters is growing daily, and we are so glad to know that you are one too! Can I send you our donation links or social media links so you can help us maintain our momentum? 

Thank you for your time and support for Roza - we look forward to having you join us soon, [voter name].

Undecided/Lean Opponent 3 - 4

I understand being undecided, and hope Roza can earn your support. I know Roza will work hard to make sure your voice is heard in our nation’s capital.

Personally, I support Roza because _____________

[SAMPLE TEXT] I’m supporting Roza because I want to send a Progressive to Congress who will fight for issues I care about like making the American economy work for all, bringing equity to education in K-12, and making healthcare truly affordable with Medicare expansion for all. In the US, 50 percent of Americans are making less than $30,000 dollars a year. Roza will make sure that we can negotiate a fair return on our wages, and when it comes to taxes, she will make sure that we see a return on our investments! Roza is also the only local candidate who is running and has an insight to the community that cannot be learned through the course of a campaign. (More info if they ask about "only local")

You can see more about Roza’s plans and the importance of this campaign on our website at electroza.org.

Do you want me to send you a text with links to Rozas website or social media so you can find out more information? 

Thank you for your time.

DO NOT Support 5 - 6 - 7 - 8

Thank you for your time, we hope Roza Calderon can win your support in the future! [END CALL]

More info on Roza's local roots

  • Tom McClintock (Incumbent) was recruited by GOP to run for CA-04, moved from Sherman Oaks in SoCal to Elk Grove, which is still outside of the district – breaking his promise of moving into the district 9 years ago.
  • Regina Bateson (Dem. Opp.) Grew up in Granite Bay, left 18 years ago and returned from Massachusetts to run for Congress, picking up residency in Roseville, CA in Mid-August.
  • Jessica Morse (Dem. Opp.) Has never lived in the District, or voted in the district, and moved from Washington DC to Pollock Pines in September 2017.
  • Both candidates reached out to Roza when they saw the excitement the constituents had rallied up when we sent McClintock running and made national headlines on Rachel Maddow, Washington Post, Huffington Post, and CNN.


(back to undecided)

Depending on your availability, you will select your available date(s), fill out this form with your information, and be sent a reminder before your scheduled call time via email and text message. A member from our dialer team will give you a call and make sure you feel ready. 

If YES can host house party: If YES to house party: Awesome! Let me sign you up and our Field Director will contact you! (go to bit.ly/housepartyroza and sign them up).

If NO cannot volunteer: It’s alright - if you find time in the future, please visit electroza.org to get involved. Our list of supporters is growing daily, and we are so glad to know that you are one too! Can I send you our donation links or social media links so you can help us maintain our momentum? 

Thank you for your time and support for Roza - we look forward to having you join us soon, [voter name].

Undecided/Lean Opponent 3 - 4

I understand being undecided, and hope Roza can earn your support. I know Roza will work hard to make sure your voice is heard in our nation’s capital.

Personally, I support Roza because _____________

[SAMPLE TEXT] I’m supporting Roza because I want to send a Progressive to Congress who will fight for issues I care about like making the American economy work for all, bringing equity to education in K-12, and making healthcare truly affordable with Medicare expansion for all. In the US, 50 percent of Americans are making less than $30,000 dollars a year. Roza will make sure that we can negotiate a fair return on our wages, and when it comes to taxes, she will make sure that we see a return on our investments! Roza is also the only local candidate who is running and has an insight to the community that cannot be learned through the course of a campaign. (More info if they ask about "only local")

You can see more about Roza’s plans and the importance of this campaign on our website at electroza.org.

Do you want me to send you a text with links to Rozas website or social media so you can find out more information? 

Thank you for your time.

DO NOT Support 5 - 6 - 7 - 8

Thank you for your time, we hope Roza Calderon can win your support in the future! [END CALL]

More info on Roza's local roots

  • Tom McClintock (Incumbent) was recruited by GOP to run for CA-04, moved from Sherman Oaks in SoCal to Elk Grove, which is still outside of the district – breaking his promise of moving into the district 9 years ago.
  • Regina Bateson (Dem. Opp.) Grew up in Granite Bay, left 18 years ago and returned from Massachusetts to run for Congress, picking up residency in Roseville, CA in Mid-August.
  • Jessica Morse (Dem. Opp.) Has never lived in the District, or voted in the district, and moved from Washington DC to Pollock Pines in September 2017.
  • Both candidates reached out to Roza when they saw the excitement the constituents had rallied up when we sent McClintock running and made national headlines on Rachel Maddow, Washington Post, Huffington Post, and CNN.


(back to undecided)

That means combatting climate change, fighting for Medicare for All, and building an inclusive economy--not because it’s popular, because it’s the right thing to do for California’s 4th District.

metadata.calling_prompt:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: California, 4th
Primary Date: 06/05/2018
Primary Type:  Top-Two Primary
Voter Registration Deadline: 05/21/2018

”Politics have been at the forefront of my life. Living in the US and the opportunities that I was afforded have not been taken for granted. The great thing about this country, is that we do not have to sit idle and let our government silence us. It is the job of our public officers to look out for the people. ” - Roza Calderon

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Roza Calderon fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people she would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting to:

  • Invest in rural America & rebuild American industry 
  • Single-payer healthcare through Medicare for all
  • Fight for equity in our K-12 system – it’s our nation’s foundation
  • Cut taxes for middle and lower income Americans
  • Defend our natural resources & protect our environment
  • Get money out of politics to ensure representation
  • Offer tuition-free education to qualified students at all public colleges & trade schools
  • Secure roadmap to citizenship and implement an employment verification system

Roza Calderon — a Progressive Democrat, California Congressional District 4 Candidate, Co-Founder of Placer Women Democrats, and Co-Founder of Indivisible Citizens of California’s 4th Congressional District, Co-Founder of California Dreamers — has been involved with the local community and politically engaged in the region for over 10 years. We need a leader with experience with their people and courage, who will do the right thing for the constituents of California’s 4th Congressional District. We need a candidate like Roza who will fight for you and always work and vote alongside the people, not the party.

”Access to quality healthcare is a human right. It is our moral obligation to make it truly affordable to all Americans. The road to freedom from corporate stronghold lies in Medicare expansion for all.” - Roza Calderon

Help us spread the message about Roza Calderon’s mission to bring real change to California and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Rosa Calderon’s story, click or tap here.

He plans to use his experience bringing people together to face down the corporate interests and lobbyists rigging our economy against working people and polluting our environment.
metafields.title: Website Blurb

metafields.value:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: New York, 19th
Primary Date: 06/26/2018
Primary Type:  Closed Primary

”Together we will face down the corporate interests and lobbyists rigging our economy against working people. Together we will pass a progressive economic agenda that creates jobs, raises wages, protects the environment and provides healthcare for all.” - Jeff Beals

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Jeff Beals fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people he would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting to:

  • Enact single-payer healthcare for all 
  • Strengthen and raise Social Security benefits
  • Innovate in sustainable and renewable energy sources
  • Bring New York’s living wage increase into fruition
  • End political corruption and get money out of politics

As a local teacher and a former U.S. diplomat with a farm in the Hudson Valley, Jeff plans to help people in NY-19 get good jobs, better wages and Medicare for All. He plans to use his experience bringing people together to face down the corporate interests and lobbyists rigging our economy against working people and polluting our environment.

”I used to believe democracy was something we fight for overseas. Today, I believe we have to fight for our democracy here at home.” - Jeff Beals

Help us spread the message about Jeff Beals’ mission to bring real change to New York and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Jeff Beals’ story, click or tap here.
metafields.title: Calling Prompt

metafields.value:
Jeff Beals Phone Banking Script

Introduction:

Hi! My name is __________________ I’m a volunteer with Jeff Beals who is running for Congress in our district against John Faso. Do you know about Jeff?

If NO: Jeff is a Democratic candidate running to take on John Faso and win back a voice for working people. He is a local teacher, decorated US Diplomat, and his family has had a farm in the Hudson Valley since his childhood.

I'm supporting Jeff because he is fighting for a progressive economic agenda that benefits working families, provides Medicare for All, combats climate change, and stands up to corporate power. He is local, progressive, and will beat John Faso. Will you vote for Jeff in the Democratic primary on June 26th?

If YES: (continue to supporter question)

Will you vote for Jeff in the Democratic primary on June 26th?

(click on result to jump to the next script section)

1 - STRONG Beals
2 - LEAN Beals
3 - UNDECIDED
4 - LEAN Opponent
 5 - STRONG Opponent
6 - LEAN Other
7 - STRONG Other
8 - NOT VOTING

Support 1 - 2

That’s great! We are on the same page. We are working hard to spread the message about Jeff’s mission to bring real change to New York’s 19th and to America. With only a few months left to organize, we need as much help as possible.

We are only going to win if we all stand up and help spread the word. Will you volunteer to help talking to voters just like I am doing right now? 

If YES can volunteer: Awesome! Let me get a little more information from you about what you want to do and then someone from the campaign office will follow up with more details and opportunities! 

If “NO” cannot volunteer It’s alright - if you find time in the future, please visit bealsforcongress.com to get involved or find an event near you! You can also see everything we are doing on facebook, twitter, and instagram.Can I send you a text with links to our website or social media so you can give us a like or follow?

Thank you for your time and support for Jeff - we look forward to having you join us soon, [voter name].

Undecided/Lean Opponent 3 - 4

It’s alright, our campaign is just getting started so you will have plenty of opportunities to get to know Jeff Beals over the next few months. Personally, I support Jeff because _____________

[SAMPLE] I support Jeff because I want to send a progressive to Congress who will fight for issues I care about like Universal health care and making the American economy work for working families.

You can see more about Jeff’s plans and the importance of this campaign on our website at bealsforcongress.com.

Do you want me to send you a text with links to Jeff’s website or social media so you can find out more information? 

Thank you for your time.

DO NOT Support 5 - 6 - 7 - 8

Thank you for your time, we hope Jeff Beals can win your support in the future!

metafields.title: Website Blurb

metafields.value:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: Arizona, 2nd
Primary Date: 08/28/2018
Primary Type: Mixed Primary

”Elected representatives must listen to their constituents and be responsive to their concerns, not hide their positions from them. I am committed to open communication with my constituents.” - Mary Matiella

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Mary Matiella fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people she would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting to:

  • Support medicare for all because healthcare is a right, not a privilege
  • Resolve income inequality and increase living wage
  • Invest in debt-free college and on-site job training
  • Advocate for the Southern Arizona Public Lands Protection Act
  • Overturn Citizens United and take money out of politics
  • Provide a pathway to citizenship for undocumented workers

After serving as CFO of the US Forest Service, and Assistant CFO of Housing and Urban Development, Dr. Matiella was nominated by President Obama to serve as Assistant Secretary of the Army. Her nomination was unanimously confirmed by the U.S. Senate. Dr. Matiella served in that capacity until her retirement in 2014. In each of these positions Dr. Matiella oversaw the development, formulation, and implementation of policies, procedures and programs for improving efficiency and effectiveness.

”At a time when racial and economic injustice are tearing our country apart, we must support programs that allow everyone to make a better life for themselves and their families.” - Mary Matiella

1 - STRONG Matiella
2 - LEAN Matiella
3 - UNDECIDED
4 - LEAN Opponent
 5 - STRONG Opponent

metadata.calling_prompt:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: Arizona, 2nd
Primary Date: 08/28/2018
Primary Type: Mixed Primary

”Elected representatives must listen to their constituents and be responsive to their concerns, not hide their positions from them. I am committed to open communication with my constituents.” - Mary Matiella

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Mary Matiella fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people she would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting to:

  • Support medicare for all because healthcare is a right, not a privilege
  • Resolve income inequality and increase living wage
  • Invest in debt-free college and on-site job training
  • Advocate for the Southern Arizona Public Lands Protection Act
  • Overturn Citizens United and take money out of politics
  • Provide a pathway to citizenship for undocumented workers

After serving as CFO of the US Forest Service, and Assistant CFO of Housing and Urban Development, Dr. Matiella was nominated by President Obama to serve as Assistant Secretary of the Army. Her nomination was unanimously confirmed by the U.S. Senate. Dr. Matiella served in that capacity until her retirement in 2014. In each of these positions Dr. Matiella oversaw the development, formulation, and implementation of policies, procedures and programs for improving efficiency and effectiveness.

”At a time when racial and economic injustice are tearing our country apart, we must support programs that allow everyone to make a better life for themselves and their families.” - Mary Matiella

Help us spread the message about Mary Matiella’s mission to bring real change to Arizona and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Mary Matiella’s story, click or tap here.

metafields.value: Brent Welder is a labor lawyer and national workers rights advocate running for Congress in Kansas’ 3rd District because billionaires and giant corporations have too much control over our government. His platform includes fighting for a $15 an hour living wage, Medicare for All, and a refusal to accept any corporate PAC or lobbyist money for his campaign.
metafields.title: Website Blurb

metafields.value:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: Kansas 3rd District
Primary Date: 08/07/2018
Primary Type: Mixed Primary

”Every woman, man, and child in the United States deserves quality health care as a right. That’s why I’m fighting for single-payer Medicare for all.” - Brent Welder

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Brent fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people he would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting for:

  • A $15 Minimum Wage 
  • Campaign Finance Reform and money out of politics
  • Middle-class workers and an end of Right-to-Work legislation
  • Fair treatment and opportunities for women and marginalized communities
  • Racial justice through more equitable legal, political, and economic systems
  • Ending student loan debt and free pre-kindergarten education 
  • A clean energy economy that will provide more jobs and slow global climate change
  • Better VA Benefits for our veterans returning home

Brent Welder is running for Congress because billionaires and giant corporations have too much control over our government. After law school, instead of joining a big corporate law firm, Brent continued with his passion—supporting workers’ rights as designated legal counsel for a national labor union. In these roles, Brent worked with local and national leaders to create better paying jobs, revitalize small businesses, and achieve better access to good healthcare. Brent understands the pain and fear that too many families face. Brent held key positions with Barack Obama, Bernie Sanders, and Patrick Murphy, the first Iraq Veteran elected to the U.S. Congress. As National Field Director for the Teamsters union, Brent organized over a million union members for better wages, benefits, and workplace safety. But for far too long under our rigged economy, giant corporations have been taking advantage of our communities and workers through lower wages and higher prices—shipping the profits away from our community to Wall Street banks and off-shore accounts. Brent is running to fix that. He will represent hard working Kansas families—not billionaires and giant corporations.

”As a worker’s rights advocate and labor lawyer, I’ve spent my career fighting the giant corporations that rig the economy against workers and our community. I’m fighting for workers. I’m fighting for hardworking Kansas families and small businesses. I’m fighting for a better tomorrow for my kids and yours. I’m fighting for your voice.” - Brent Welder

Help us spread the message about Brent’s mission to bring real change to Kansas 3rd District and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Brent Welder’s story, click or tap here.
metafields.title: Calling Prompt

metafields.value:
Brent Welder Phone Banking Script

Introduction:

Hi, this is ______? Great, my name is _______ and I’m spreading the word about Brent Welder’s Congressional campaign. Have you heard that Brent?

If NO: That’s okay! Brent Welder is a national worker’s rights advocate and labor lawyer that has spent his career fighting on behalf of working families against giant corporations and billionaires that rig our economy and our political process. He supports single-payer Medicare for All, a $15 minimum wage, and has always fought to get corporate money out of our elections. (go to second ask)

If YES: Fanatastic! (move on to next section)

Can he count on your support here in the Kansas 3rd to take on Republican Kevin Yoder and stop Donald Trump?

(click on result to jump to the next script section)

1 - STRONG Welder
2 - LEAN Welder
3 - UNDECIDED
4 - LEAN Yoder
 5 - STRONG Yoder
6 - LEAN Other
7 - STRONG Other
8 - NOT VOTING

Support 1 - 2

That’s great! We’re working hard to spread our message and we only have a few months to organize the District and get the real change we need, so your help is really valuable. If we all stand up, we can win this. Would you be able to volunteer and help us beat Republican Kevin Yoder?

If YES, can volunteer: I’m going to sign you up to be on his volunteer list so someone from the campaign will be in touch soon! (click button below and sign them up as a volunteer)

If NO, cannot volunteer: Alright - if you find time in the future, please visit brentwelder.com to get involved. You can also see everything we are doing on our Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.

Can I send you a text with links to our website or social media so you can give us a like or follow? We want you to stay updated with the campaign!

If YES: Great! (Click on button below and fill out form for them)

If NO: (move on with to next part...)

Thank you for your time and support for Brent - we look forward to having you join us soon, [voter name]. Have a great day!

Undecided/Lean Opponent 3 - 4

It’s alright, our campaign is all over the district so you will have plenty of opportunities to get to know Brent over the next few months.

Brent wants to know what issues are important to people in the Kansas 3rd. What issue matters to you most in this year? (if voter declines to answer, move to next section)

Do you want me to send you a text with links to Brent’s website or social media so you can find out more information? 

If YES: Great! (click on button below and fill out form for them)

If NO: You can see more about Brent’s plans and the importance of this campaign on our website at brentwelder.com

Thank you for your time, we hope Brent can win your support.

DO NOT Support 5 - 6 - 7 - 8

Thank you for your time, [voter name], we hope Brent Welder can win your support in the future!

I’m fighting for hardworking Kansas families and small businesses. I’m fighting for a better tomorrow for my kids and yours. I’m fighting for your voice.” - Brent Welder

Help us spread the message about Brent’s mission to bring real change to Kansas 3rd District and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Brent Welder’s story, click or tap here.

metafields.value:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: Colorado’s 5th District
Primary Date: 06/26/2018
Primary Type: Open

”I pledge to not take contributions from the oil, gas, and coal industry and instead prioritize the health of our families, climate, and democracy over fossil fuel industry profits.” - Stephany Rose Spaulding

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Stephany fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people he would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting for:

  • Affordable and accessible health care for all Americans
  • Support for our veterans from recruitment to retirement
  • Access to equitable education regardless of zipcode
  • Developing energy infrastructure that relies on wind, solar, and hydroelectric technologies
  • Creating a Green Silicon Mountain sustainable technologies economy with the Rocky Mountains
  • Sustainable wages, new job opportunities, and an affordable housing market

Since making Colorado her home, Stephany Rose has taken an active role in the community. In addition to teaching, in 2015 she founded For Our Children’s Children Enterprises, which is dedicated to creating an inheritable world for America’s future generations. She is active as a board member and participant for many local community organizations that promote and support justice and social equality for all. The many organizations and causes that have benefitted from her leadership include both the faith and secular communities like Project Impact, Raw Tools, Together Colorado, the Rocky Mountain Women’s Film Institute, the Colorado Springs Urban League, the YMCA Pikes Peak Region Education Task Force, and the Colorado Springs Black Advisory Council. Stephany Rose is new to the political landscape of the Front Range, but the last election cycle exposed a need for people who will genuinely listen to their constituents. More than Just believing, Rev. Dr. Stephany Rose Spaulding truly lives her life focused on inclusion and innovation. She will give voice to each person in Colorado's 5th COngressional District.

”True governance only happens when people are treated with dignity. Restore the decency of our country by electing brilliantly qualified people of color, women, multi-faith loving, Americans from all backgrounds into office. We are out here running! Please support us.” - Stephany Rose Spaulding

Help us spread the message about Stephany’s mission to bring real change to Colorado’s 5th District and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Stephany Rose Spaulding’s story, click or tap here.
metafields.title: Calling Prompt

metafields.value:
Stephany Rose Spaulding Phone Banking Script

Introduction:

Hello, my name is ______ may I please speak with [voter name]? I’m a volunteer with the Stephany Rose Spaulding for Colorado’s 5 th Congressional, U.S. House Campaign in 2018. Have you heard of Stephany yet?

If have NOT heard of her: Stephany Rose Spaulding is running a grassroots campaign for Congress to be a true Representative in Washington for Coloradans. She is understanding the lack of representation and engagement by current incumbent, Doug Lamborn, has jeopardized the welfare of Coloradans when it comes to Education, Employment, Healthcare and of course the beautiful landscape of our state.

Can she count on your support during the Caucus in March and vote in Colorado’s Democratic primary in June 2018?

(click on result to jump to the next script section)

1 - STRONG Spaulding
2 - LEAN Spaulding
3 - UNDECIDED
4 - LEAN Opponent
 5 - STRONG Opponent
6 - LEAN Other
7 - STRONG Other
8 - NOT VOTING

Support 1 - 2

Great! That's very helpful to us. We're working hard to spread our message and we only have a few months to organize the District and get the real change we need, so your help is really valuable. If we all stand up, we can win this. Are you available to help knock on doors or make calls to voters just like I am doing right now?

If YES, can volunteer: I’m going to sign you up to be on her volunteer list so someone from the campaign will be in touch soon! (click button below and sign them up as a volunteer)

If NO, cannot volunteer: Alright - if you find time in the future, please visit stephanyroseforcongress.com to get involved. You can also see everything we are doing on our Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.

Can I send you a text with links to our website or social media so you can give us a like or follow? We want you to stay updated with the campaign!

If YES: Great! (Click on button below and fill out form for them)

If NO: (move on with to next part...)

Thank you for your time and support for Stephany - we look forward to having you join us soon, [voter name].

Undecided/Lean Opponent 3 - 4

It’s alright, our campaign is just getting started so you will have plenty of opportunities to get to know Stephany over the next few months.

Personally, I support Stephany because _____________

 EXAMPLE:

More than just believing, Reverend Dr. Stephany Rose Spaulding truly lives her life focused on inclusion and innovation. She will give voice to each person in Colorado's 5th Congressional District.

Do you want me to send you a text with links to Stephany's website or social media so you can find out more information? 

If YES: Great! (click on button below and fill out form for them)

If NO: (move on to next part...)

You can see more about Stephany’s plans and the importance of this campaign on our website at stephanyroseforcongress.com

Thank you for your time, we hope Stephany can win your support.

DO NOT Support 5 - 6 - 7 - 8

Thank you for your time, [voter name], we hope Stephany Rose Spaulding can win your support in the future!

metafields.value: Jenny Marshall is a public school teacher and community organizer. She is running because for far too long our families and communities have been ignored, dismissed and disenfranchised. Wall Street and huge conglomerates have put profits over people. This must change. Jenny is prepared to step up and fight for all of us in Washington. That means passing Medicare-for-all, investing in our future and helping to create economic equity for all people.
metafields.title: Website Blurb

metafields.value:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: North Carolina’s 5th District
Primary Date: 05/08/2018
Primary Type: Open

”We have the resources to take care of the issues important to us: jobs, healthcare, education, the environment, social security, the list goes on. The choice is ours. Will we take the bold step and demand that our country represent we the people? ” - Jenny Marshall

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Jenny fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people she would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting for:

  • North Carolina manufacturing jobs and productivity
  • Social Security and Medicare for all
  • Education funding and free-tuition public univiersities
  • Farm-to-fork initiatives and agricultural education programs in support of farmers and rural North Carolina
  • Ending the War on Drugs and legalizing marijuana
  • Money out of politics and ending Citizen's United
  • Women’s reproductive rights 
  • LGBTQ and racial justice 

Jenny Marshall is a public school teacher running a bold progressive campaign in North Carolina’s 5th District. At JFK High School, Jenny served as the Student Council Adviser, a member of the School Improvement team, and the chair of the Social Studies Department. She is also an active member of her local, state and national teachers association. Jenny’s work as an educator goes beyond her work in the classroom, though — While she was teaching in Indiana, Jenny took the lead in building one of the largest coalitions of teachers, parents, and education advocates to fight against the GOP’s attack on public education and the teachers’ unions. Jenny’s group of over 9,000 advocates collaborated with labor unions and civic groups to organize rallies, town halls, and letter-writing campaigns. Their efforts resulted in real change as the state legislature was forced to abandon some of the most horrible attacks on students and educators. As shown, Jenny is a fighter and she will continue the fight for all of us in Washington D.C.

In addition to educational causes, Jenny has devoted her life to advancing progressive candidates and values at all levels of government. Jenny has served as a member of the North Carolina Democratic Party Platforms and Resolutions Committee, as a founding member of the North Carolina Democratic Party Progressive Caucus, and as the President of Triad Progressives. She has spent thousands of hours knocking on doors, making phone calls, and organizing her community for progressive candidates. In 2016, she organized her precinct and flipped it from red to blue for the first time in a decade.

”For far too long our families and communities have been ignored, dismissed and disenfranchised. We have witnessed stagnated wages and good paying jobs are hard to find. Wall Street and huge conglomerates have put profits over people. This must change. We must begin doing what is right for all of us. ” - Jenny Marshall

Help us spread the message about Jenny’s mission to bring real change to North Carolina’s 5th District and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Jenny Marshall’s story, click or tap here.
metafields.title: Calling Prompt

metafields.value:
Jenny Marshall Phone Banking Script

Introduction:

Hello, my name is______ and I’m a volunteer for Jenny Marshall — a Progressive Democrat running for US Congress to unseat incumbent Virginia Foxx. May I please speak with __________?

Hi _______! Have you heard of Jenny and her campaign?

If NO: That's ok and exactly why I'm calling! As a middle school teacher, Jenny knows the struggles our children and their families face. That is why she decided to run for Congress, to ensure everyone has a living wage, protect Social Security, expand Medicare for all, and get big money out of politics. Unlike Virginia Foxx, Jenny is not taking any money from corporate PACs. Jenny Marshall is running a progressive, people-powered campaign funded by individual contributions.

If YES: Great! Jenny is fighting to ensure everyone has a living wage, protecting Social Security, expanding Medicare for all, and getting big money out of politics.

Can Jenny count on your support and vote in the May Democratic primary? 

(click on result to jump to the next script section)

1 - STRONG Marshall
2 - LEAN Marshall
3 - UNDECIDED
4 - LEAN Opponent
 5 - STRONG Opponent
6 - LEAN Other
7 - STRONG Other
8 - NOT VOTING

Support 1 - 2

That's great! We are getting a lot of community support, and we are on track to win as more people hear our message. Do you want to get involved and help Jenny win?

If YES, can volunteer:  Awesome! Let's get you signed up and get you on our email list and someone will reach out to you soon about opportunities with the campaign: (click button below and sign them up))

If NO, can't volunteer: Alright - if you find time in the future, please visit marshallforhouse.org to get involved. You can also see everything we are doing on our Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. (move on to the next question…)

Can I send you a text with links to our website or social media so you can give us a like or follow? We want you to stay updated with the campaign!

If YES: Great! (Click on button below and fill out form for them)

If NO:  (Move on to next part…)

Thank you for your time and support for Jenny - we look forward to having you join us soon, [voter name].

Undecided/Lean Opponent 3 - 4

It’s alright, our campaign is doing actions all over, so you will have plenty of opportunities to get to know Jenny over the next few months.

Personally, I support Jenny because _____________

EXAMPLE:

Jenny goes beyond her work in the classroom as an educator - she has spent decades advocating for teachers, students, and parents on a legislative level. While she was teaching in Indiana, Jenny took the lead in building one of the largest coalitions of teachers, parents, and education advocates to fight against the GOP’s attack on public education and the teachers’ unions. Jenny’s group of over 9,000 advocates collaborated with labor unions and civic groups to organize rallies, town halls, and letter-writing campaigns. Their efforts resulted in real change as the state legislature was forced to abandon some of the most horrible attacks on students and educators. This is the kind of will power North Carolina needs right now.

Do you want me to send you a text with links to Jenny's website or social media so you can find out more information? 

If YES:  (click on button below and fill out form for them)

If NO: No worries. You can see more about Jenny’s plans and the importance of this campaign on our website at marshallforhouse.org

Thank you for your time, we hope Jenny can win your support.

DO NOT Support 5 - 6 - 7 - 8

Thank you for your time, [voter name], we hope Jenny Marshall can win your support in the future!

If YES: Great! Jenny is fighting to ensure everyone has a living wage, protecting Social Security, expanding Medicare for all, and getting big money out of politics.

Can Jenny count on your support and vote in the May Democratic primary?

If YES, can volunteer:  Awesome! Let's get you signed up and get you on our email list and someone will reach out to you soon about opportunities with the campaign: (click button below and sign them up))

If NO, can't volunteer: Alright - if you find time in the future, please visit marshallforhouse.org to get involved. You can also see everything we are doing on our Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. (move on to the next question…)

Jenny’s group of over 9,000 advocates collaborated with labor unions and civic groups to organize rallies, town halls, and letter-writing campaigns. Their efforts resulted in real change as the state legislature was forced to abandon some of the most horrible attacks on students and educators. This is the kind of will power North Carolina needs right now.

Thank you for your time, we hope Jenny can win your support.

metadata.calling_prompt:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: North Carolina’s 5th District
Primary Date: 05/08/2018
Primary Type: Open

”We have the resources to take care of the issues important to us: jobs, healthcare, education, the environment, social security, the list goes on. The choice is ours. Will we take the bold step and demand that our country represent we the people? ” - Jenny Marshall

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Jenny fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people she would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting for:

  • North Carolina manufacturing jobs and productivity
  • Social Security and Medicare for all
  • Education funding and free-tuition public univiersities
  • Farm-to-fork initiatives and agricultural education programs in support of farmers and rural North Carolina
  • Ending the War on Drugs and legalizing marijuana
  • Money out of politics and ending Citizen's United
  • Women’s reproductive rights 
  • LGBTQ and racial justice 

Jenny Marshall is a public school teacher running a bold progressive campaign in North Carolina’s 5th District. At JFK High School, Jenny served as the Student Council Adviser, a member of the School Improvement team, and the chair of the Social Studies Department. She is also an active member of her local, state and national teachers association. Jenny’s work as an educator goes beyond her work in the classroom, though — While she was teaching in Indiana, Jenny took the lead in building one of the largest coalitions of teachers, parents, and education advocates to fight against the GOP’s attack on public education and the teachers’ unions. Jenny’s group of over 9,000 advocates collaborated with labor unions and civic groups to organize rallies, town halls, and letter-writing campaigns. Their efforts resulted in real change as the state legislature was forced to abandon some of the most horrible attacks on students and educators. As shown, Jenny is a fighter and she will continue the fight for all of us in Washington D.C.

In addition to educational causes, Jenny has devoted her life to advancing progressive candidates and values at all levels of government. Jenny has served as a member of the North Carolina Democratic Party Platforms and Resolutions Committee, as a founding member of the North Carolina Democratic Party Progressive Caucus, and as the President of Triad Progressives. She has spent thousands of hours knocking on doors, making phone calls, and organizing her community for progressive candidates. In 2016, she organized her precinct and flipped it from red to blue for the first time in a decade.

”For far too long our families and communities have been ignored, dismissed and disenfranchised. We have witnessed stagnated wages and good paying jobs are hard to find. Wall Street and huge conglomerates have put profits over people. This must change. We must begin doing what is right for all of us. ” - Jenny Marshall

Help us spread the message about Jenny’s mission to bring real change to North Carolina’s 5th District and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Jenny Marshall’s story, click or tap here.

metafields.value: Darlene McDonald is a published author of four novels and technology professional who has called Utah home for 15 years. She is now running in Utah's Fourth Congressional District to remove the influence of big money from our politics, raise the minimum wage to a living wage at $15 an hour, and stop the government from playing politics with our healthcare.

She is now running in Utah's Fourth Congressional District to remove the influence of big money from our politics, raise the minimum wage to a living wage at $15 an hour, and stop the government from playing politics with our healthcare.

metafields.value: As a community leader and civil rights activist in the Lehigh Valley for 20 years, Greg Edwards will bring a deep understanding of the intersectionality between core progressive values to Capitol Hill. He believes it’s time to reclaim what it means to be a democrat — free from lukewarm moderation — by fighting for campaign finance reform, Medicare for All, equitable education funding, free college tuition, economic justice, and civic empowerment.
metafields.title: Website Blurb

metafields.value:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: Pennsylvania’s 7th District
Primary Date: 05/15/2018
Primary Type: Party members only

”I believe our current political system is centered on politicians and not people. This moment does not call for moderation, but revolutionary ideals rooted in progress: single-payer health care, livable wages, and equitable education funding.” - Greg Edwards

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Greg fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people he would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting for:

  • Campaign finance reform
  • Access to healthcare and Medicare-for-All 
  • Tax reform that will benefit working-class people
  • A path to citizenship that does not divide families
  • Debt-free college and fair funding for all public schools
  • Eliminating mandatory minimum sentencing
  • Climate justice and more jobs through a Green New Deal
  • Expansion Civil Rights Act of 1964
  • Reproductive freedom and support

Greg is the Founder and Senior Pastor of Resurrected Life Community Church and the President and CEO of Resurrected Community Development Corporation, which led to the creation of the Resurrected Life Children’s Academy, the James Lawson Freedom School, and the Campaign for Change organizing initiative. He has spent the last 20 years building a racially diverse, culturally rich, economically self-sufficient, and politically aware community that has addressed racial, economic, and educational disparities within Allentown and throughout the greater Lehigh Valley. Greg is a devoted husband, father, and son who has lived in the Lehigh Valley for more than 25 years. He is running because he sees the need for a bold new vision of a prosperous 7th District where everyone’s full potential as human beings is given the opportunity to learn, live, and thrive. 

”We have people who are suffering. We have people who are having to negotiate whether to take their medication or put groceries on the table. We have political leaders that don’t really understand that struggle… I’ve spent most of my life advocating in marginalized communities where people have been made to feel invisible, and unfortunately, public policy has made them almost disposable.” - Greg Edwards

Help us spread the message about Greg’s mission to bring real change to Pennsylvania’s 7th District and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Greg Edward’s story, click or tap here.
metafields.title: Calling Prompt

metafields.value:
Greg Edwards Phone Banking Script

Introduction:

Hi, my name is _________ and I’m a volunteer with the Greg Edwards for Congress Campaign. May I speak to _______?

Have you heard of Greg Edwards before?

If YES: (Move on to support question...)

If NO: Greg Edwards is fighting to get money out of politics, and for universal healthcare and higher wages that put people before corporations and wealthy donors. As a community leader for over 25 years, Greg knows Washington has left us behind, and he is ready to fight for all of us.

Could Greg count on your vote in the upcoming Democratic Primary on May 15?

(click on result to jump to the next script section)

1 - STRONG Edwards
2 - LEAN Edwards
3 - UNDECIDED
4 - LEAN Opponent
 5 - STRONG Opponent
6 - LEAN Other
7 - STRONG Other
8 - NOT VOTING

Support 1 - 2

That’s great! Thank you so much. I know Greg appreciates your support. We are working hard to spread the message about his mission to bring real change. With only a couple months left to organize, we need as much help as possible. Greg strongly believes we need to engage our neighbors to get involved and vote in the election. Can we count on your to volunteer? 

If YES, can volunteer: Awesome! (click button below and sign them up as a volunteer). We have events that will be coming up soon - in the meantime, I’m going to sign you up to be on her volunteer list so someone from the campaign will be in touch shortly!

If NO, can't volunteer: No worries. Please spread the word about our campaign to your family and friends. If you find time in the future, please visit edwardsforpa.com to get involved.

Thank you for your time and support for Greg. We look forward to having you join us soon, [voter name].

Undecided/Lean Opponent 3 - 4

I understand being undecided, and hope Greg can earn your support. To best serve her fellow Pennsylvanians, he truly believes this campaign is about listening to the concerns of Pennsylvania and our families - Out of these following issues, can you pick one which is most important to you?

Jobs and Economy

Healthcare

Government Transparency

Education

Climate Change

Campaign Finance Reform

Other

(Record response in agent desktop as 3 - Undecided - [ISSUE] )

Yes, that is very important. Personally, I support Greg because _____________

SAMPLE EXAMPLE: He has been a leader in community in the Lehigh Valley for 20 years and knows what it’s like to live paycheck to paycheck. Like many of us, Greg thinks members of Congress are disconnected from everyday Americans, which is why he is running on a bold progressive platform that includes Medicare for All, debt-free college, and higher wages. We hope you’ll consider Greg Edwards.

You can see more about Greg’s plans and the importance of this campaign on our website at edwardsforpa.com 

Thank you for your time, we hope Greg can win your support. 

DO NOT Support 5 - 6 - 7 - 8

Thank you for your time, we hope Greg Edwards can win your support in the future!

metafields.value: David is an educator, union representative, and community organizer challenging a now-vulnerable 16-term GOP incumbent in Michigan’s 6th. David is committed to ensuring health care and education for all and erasing dark money from politics.
metafields.title: Website Blurb

metafields.value:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: Michigan, 6th
Primary Date: 08/07/2018
Primary Type: Open Primary
Voter Registration Deadline: 07/09/2018

”We must also protect the dignity of all the members of our communities if we want a nation where life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness are possible. This means that everyone who works full-time must have a living wage. Education, whether academic, vocational, or another type, must never throw hard-working students into a lifetime of debt. The United States is a uniquely diverse nation, an identity that provides us an opportunity to be a model for the rest of the world. ” - David Benac

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, David Benac fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people he would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting to:

  • Fight for Medicare for all and women’s reproductive health, mental health, and quality of health
  • End for-profit prisons and aggressive policing
  • Demand government transparency and remove corporate influence and gerrymandering
  • Eliminate right-to-work laws, the pay gap, and gender/racial/sexual identity based discrimination
  • Address green jobs, a living wage, and combat automation through with more occupation training
  • Expand the VA program to rehabilitate our veterans
  • Ensure civil rights and religious liberty for all
  • End for-profit schools and support publicly funded education through college 
  • Protect the environment, Great Lakes, public lands, the EPA and Superfund, and the Endangered Species Act 

 Upon joining the history department at the University of Michigan, David was elected as a member of the Association Council of the American Association of University Professors as well as serve on the Kalamazoo Historic Preservation Council by his faculty. In the years that followed, he helped form Organize West Michigan, became co-chair of the Environmental Task Force of ProKzoo, joined the steering committee for the Kalamazoo Complete Streets Initiative, co-chaired the Kalamazoo Earth Day Festival, won election to Vice Chair of the Michigan Democratic Party Environment Caucus, and was a delegate for Senator Bernie Sanders to the Platform Committee of the Democratic National Committee.

”Clean water, air, soil, and food free from toxins, safe workplaces, healthcare, and equality under the law are human rights. These rights may not be enshrined in the Constitution, but I believe they are fundamental to the continuation of human society. In the United States, we must commit to ensuring the human rights of all people.” - David Benac

Help us spread the message about David Benac’s mission to bring real change to Michigan and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of David Benac’s story, click or tap here.
metafields.title: Calling Prompt

metafields.value:
David Benac Phone Banking Script

Introduction:

Hi, is [voter name] available?

Hi [voter name], my name is ____ and I’m volunteering with the David Benac for Congress campaign. David is an educator, union representative, and native Michigander running to unseat Fred Upton. Have you heard about David's candidacy?

If Yes: All good - (move on to next question)

If No: David Benac is a progressive Democrat, running a grassroots campaign for Congress to enact Medicare for all, eliminate the corrupting influence of big money on politics, create living wage jobs, protect and expand social security, and establish a progressive agricultural policy.

Can David count on your support and vote in Michigan's Democratic primary in August 2018? 

(click on result to jump to the next script section)

1 - STRONG Benac
2 - LEAN Benac
3 - UNDECIDED
4 - LEAN Opponent
 5 - STRONG Opponent
6 - LEAN Other
7 - STRONG Other
8 - NOT VOTING

Support 1 - 2

Are you available to help knock on doors or make calls to voters just like I am doing right now?

metadata.calling_prompt:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: Michigan, 6th
Primary Date: 08/07/2018
Primary Type: Open Primary
Voter Registration Deadline: 07/09/2018

”We must also protect the dignity of all the members of our communities if we want a nation where life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness are possible. This means that everyone who works full-time must have a living wage. Education, whether academic, vocational, or another type, must never throw hard-working students into a lifetime of debt. The United States is a uniquely diverse nation, an identity that provides us an opportunity to be a model for the rest of the world. ” - David Benac

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, David Benac fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people he would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting to:

  • Fight for Medicare for all and women’s reproductive health, mental health, and quality of health
  • End for-profit prisons and aggressive policing
  • Demand government transparency and remove corporate influence and gerrymandering
  • Eliminate right-to-work laws, the pay gap, and gender/racial/sexual identity based discrimination
  • Address green jobs, a living wage, and combat automation through with more occupation training
  • Expand the VA program to rehabilitate our veterans
  • Ensure civil rights and religious liberty for all
  • End for-profit schools and support publicly funded education through college 
  • Protect the environment, Great Lakes, public lands, the EPA and Superfund, and the Endangered Species Act 

 Upon joining the history department at the University of Michigan, David was elected as a member of the Association Council of the American Association of University Professors as well as serve on the Kalamazoo Historic Preservation Council by his faculty. In the years that followed, he helped form Organize West Michigan, became co-chair of the Environmental Task Force of ProKzoo, joined the steering committee for the Kalamazoo Complete Streets Initiative, co-chaired the Kalamazoo Earth Day Festival, won election to Vice Chair of the Michigan Democratic Party Environment Caucus, and was a delegate for Senator Bernie Sanders to the Platform Committee of the Democratic National Committee.

”Clean water, air, soil, and food free from toxins, safe workplaces, healthcare, and equality under the law are human rights. These rights may not be enshrined in the Constitution, but I believe they are fundamental to the continuation of human society. In the United States, we must commit to ensuring the human rights of all people.” - David Benac

Help us spread the message about David Benac’s mission to bring real change to Michigan and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of David Benac’s story, click or tap here.

metafields.value: Amy Vilela in Nevada’s 4th District believes that we don't have time to wait for career politicians, their donors, or special interests to do the right thing -- she will fight and will never stop advocating for Medicare for All, a $15/hour living wage, a Green New Deal, and democratic and electoral reforms that remove Big Money from politics.
metafields.title: Website Blurb

metafields.value:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: Nevada, 04th District
Primary Date: 06/12/2018
Primary Type: Closed

”My formal entry into politics and advocacy came in the wake of my daughter, Shalynne's, death at the hands of our nation's profit-driven healthcare system, but my campaign is about much more than Shalynne, and it's about more than healthcare. It’s about fighting to put people over profit, whether it's in education, housing, energy, criminal justice, the climate, or our democracy itself.” - Amy Vilela

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Amy fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people she would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting for:

  • True racial, social and economic justice
  • Access to healthcare and Medicare-for-All 
  • Working-class people, families, and a living wage
  • Affordable housing and alleviating homelessness 
  • Immigration reform and the Clean Dream Act
  • Criminal justice reform and ending the War on Drugs
  • Energy and climate justice through a Green New Deal
  • Tuition-free colleges and universities and access to quality education
  • Government corruption and taking money out of politics

Growing up in poverty and raising her children as a single mother has taught her to fight for strong social programs that help Americans reach their full potential. With the help of food stamps, WIC and Medicaid, she was able to work myself through college and become the first person in my family to earn a degree. Later, as a CFO in the non-profit sector, she fought to ensure federal funds for HUD programs and Medicaid reached those that needed it most. Her story illustrates how necessary public assistance is while also demonstrating how inadequate and alienating our current system and policies are. We must stop thinking of vital social programs as a "safety net" to catch us when we fall. Policies that meet everyone's basic needs – a guaranteed livable wage, access to free public education and healthcare, affordable housing – need to be recognized as the concrete foundation upon which our society is built, allowing us all to grow, thrive, and reach our full potential with equity and dignity. 

”Racial, social, and economic injustice are pervasive in America. They are not discrete, unrelated issues, but inextricably linked. Our approach to social justice must bring all Nevada voices to the table.” - Amy Vilela

Help us spread the message about Amy’s mission to bring real change to Nevada and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Amy Vilela’s story, click or tap here.
metafields.title: Calling Prompt

metafields.value:
Amy Vilela Phone Banking Script

Introduction:

Hi, is [voter name ] available? My name is __________________ I’m a volunteer with Amy Vilela who is running for Congress.

Amy Vilela is a progressive running for Congress in Nevada's 4th District. Amy is a business woman turned Medicare For All activist after her daughter, Shalynne, died at the hands of our nation's profit-driven healthcare system. She will never stop fighting for the people. She understands the struggles that keep people up at night. She knows that families are one sickness away from losing their home. Now more than ever Amy Vilela is the champion we need for our community and for the future of Nevadans. Since you care about our community and the future of Nevadans, I hope Amy can count on your support.

In the 2018 Democratic Primary, can Amy Vilela count on your support in her bid for Congress here in the 4th Congressional District? 

(click on result to jump to the next script section)

1 - STRONG Vilela
2 - LEAN Vilela
3 - UNDECIDED
4 - LEAN Opponent
 5 - STRONG Opponent
6 - LEAN Other
7 - STRONG Other
8 - NOT VOTING

Support 1 - 2

That’s great! We are on the same page. We are working hard to spread the message about Amy’s mission to bring real change to Nevada’s 4th and to America. With only a few months left to organize, we need as much help as possible. Amy strongly believes we need to engage our neighbors to get involved and vote in the election.Can we count on you to engage your neighborhood? 

If YES, can volunteer: Awesome! (click button below and sign them up as a volunteer). We have events that will be coming up soon - in the meantime, I’m going to sign you up to be on her volunteer list so someone from the campaign will be in touch shortly!

If NO, can't volunteer: No worries. Please spread the word about our campaign to your family and friends. Can I send you a text with links to our website or social media so you can give us a like or follow? We want you to stay updated with the campaign!

If YES: Great! (Click on button below and fill out form for them)

If NO: (move on with to next part...)

Alright - if you find time in the future, please visit Amy4thepeople.com to get involved.

Thank you for your time and support for Amy. We look forward to having you join us soon, [voter name].

Undecided/Lean Opponent 3 - 4

I understand being undecided, and hope Amy can earn your support. To best serve her fellow Nevadans, Amy truly believes this campaign is about listening to the concerns of Nevadans and their families. Out of these following issues, can you pick one which is most important to you?

Jobs and Economy

Healthcare

Government Transparency

Education

Environment

Other

(Record response in agent desktop as 3 - Undecided - [ISSUE] )

Yes, that is very important. Personally, I support Amy because _____________

SAMPLE EXAMPLE: I’m supporting Amy because I want to send a progressive to Congress who will fight for issues I care about like Universal health care and making the American economy work for working families, single mothers who are working 2 jobs to barely make ends meet and for all those people who are struggling to feed their children and hold down a full time job. She understands because she has lived it.

Do you want me to send you a text with links to Amys website or social media so you can find out more information? 

If YES: Great! (click on button below and fill out form for them)

If NO: (move on to next part...)

You can see more about Amy’s plans and the importance of this campaign on our website at Amy4thepeople.com 

Thank you for your time, we hope Amy can win your support. 

DO NOT Support 5 - 6 - 7 - 8

Thank you for your time, we hope Amy Vilela can win your support in the future!
