Amy is a business woman turned Medicare For All activist after her daughter, Shalynne, died at the hands of our nation's profit-driven healthcare system. She will never stop fighting for the people. She understands the struggles that keep people up at night. She knows that families are one sickness away from losing their home. Now more than ever Amy Vilela is the champion we need for our community and for the future of Nevadans. Since you care about our community and the future of Nevadans, I hope Amy can count on your support.

In the 2018 Democratic Primary, can Amy Vilela count on your support in her bid for Congress here in the 4th Congressional District? 

(click on result to jump to the next script section)

1 - STRONG Vilela
2 - LEAN Vilela
3 - UNDECIDED
4 - LEAN Opponent
 5 - STRONG Opponent
6 - LEAN Other
7 - STRONG Other
8 - NOT VOTING

Support 1 - 2

That’s great! We are on the same page. We are working hard to spread the message about Amy’s mission to bring real change to Nevada’s 4th and to America. With only a few months left to organize, we need as much help as possible. Amy strongly believes we need to engage our neighbors to get involved and vote in the election.Can we count on you to engage your neighborhood? 

If YES, can volunteer: Awesome! (click button below and sign them up as a volunteer). We have events that will be coming up soon - in the meantime, I’m going to sign you up to be on her volunteer list so someone from the campaign will be in touch shortly!

If NO, can't volunteer: No worries. Please spread the word about our campaign to your family and friends. Can I send you a text with links to our website or social media so you can give us a like or follow? We want you to stay updated with the campaign!

If YES: Great! (Click on button below and fill out form for them)

If NO: (move on with to next part...)

Alright - if you find time in the future, please visit Amy4thepeople.com to get involved.

Thank you for your time and support for Amy. We look forward to having you join us soon, [voter name].

Undecided/Lean Opponent 3 - 4

I understand being undecided, and hope Amy can earn your support. To best serve her fellow Nevadans, Amy truly believes this campaign is about listening to the concerns of Nevadans and their families. Out of these following issues, can you pick one which is most important to you?

Jobs and Economy

Healthcare

Government Transparency

Education

Environment

Other

(Record response in agent desktop as 3 - Undecided - [ISSUE] )

Yes, that is very important. Personally, I support Amy because _____________

SAMPLE EXAMPLE: I’m supporting Amy because I want to send a progressive to Congress who will fight for issues I care about like Universal health care and making the American economy work for working families, single mothers who are working 2 jobs to barely make ends meet and for all those people who are struggling to feed their children and hold down a full time job. She understands because she has lived it.

Do you want me to send you a text with links to Amys website or social media so you can find out more information? 

If YES: Great! (click on button below and fill out form for them)

If NO: (move on to next part...)

You can see more about Amy’s plans and the importance of this campaign on our website at Amy4thepeople.com 

Thank you for your time, we hope Amy can win your support. 

DO NOT Support 5 - 6 - 7 - 8

Thank you for your time, we hope Amy Vilela can win your support in the future!

metadata.calling_prompt:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: Nevada, 04th District
Primary Date: 06/12/2018
Primary Type: Closed

”My formal entry into politics and advocacy came in the wake of my daughter, Shalynne's, death at the hands of our nation's profit-driven healthcare system, but my campaign is about much more than Shalynne, and it's about more than healthcare. It’s about fighting to put people over profit, whether it's in education, housing, energy, criminal justice, the climate, or our democracy itself.” - Amy Vilela

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Amy fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people she would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting for:

  • True racial, social and economic justice
  • Access to healthcare and Medicare-for-All 
  • Working-class people, families, and a living wage
  • Affordable housing and alleviating homelessness 
  • Immigration reform and the Clean Dream Act
  • Criminal justice reform and ending the War on Drugs
  • Energy and climate justice through a Green New Deal
  • Tuition-free colleges and universities and access to quality education
  • Government corruption and taking money out of politics

Growing up in poverty and raising her children as a single mother has taught her to fight for strong social programs that help Americans reach their full potential. With the help of food stamps, WIC and Medicaid, she was able to work myself through college and become the first person in my family to earn a degree. Later, as a CFO in the non-profit sector, she fought to ensure federal funds for HUD programs and Medicaid reached those that needed it most. Her story illustrates how necessary public assistance is while also demonstrating how inadequate and alienating our current system and policies are. We must stop thinking of vital social programs as a "safety net" to catch us when we fall. Policies that meet everyone's basic needs – a guaranteed livable wage, access to free public education and healthcare, affordable housing – need to be recognized as the concrete foundation upon which our society is built, allowing us all to grow, thrive, and reach our full potential with equity and dignity. 

”Racial, social, and economic injustice are pervasive in America. They are not discrete, unrelated issues, but inextricably linked. Our approach to social justice must bring all Nevada voices to the table.” - Amy Vilela

Help us spread the message about Amy’s mission to bring real change to Nevada and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Amy Vilela’s story, click or tap here.

metafields.value: As a candidate for Texas’s 23rd District, Rick is committed to fighting for Medicare for All, strengthening and fully funding his district's rural health care systems, and getting big money lobbyists and special interest out of politics.
metafields.title: Website Blurb

metafields.value:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: Texas, 23rd District
Primary Date: 03/06/2018
Primary Type: Party Members and Unaffiliated

”This fence separates two communities and where Donald Trump wants to build his wall. A 'wall' based on racism, bigotry, and injustice... We need to stand up to these terrible ideas — ideas that will tear communities apart and demonize hard-working people.” - Rick Trevino

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Rick Trevino fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people she would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting to:

  • Passing Medicare-for-All to guarantee health care as a right
  • Raising the minimum wage to a living wage
  • Free public colleges and universities
  • Fighting climate change
  • Fixing our immigration policy and providing a pathway towards citizenship
  • Ending mass incarceration and reforming our broken criminal justice system 
  • Getting big money out of politics 

Rick Trevino is a teacher running for Congress. He is a true progressive with a record of standing up to DC politicians and fighting for working families. Rick is the one candidate in the Democratic Primary with a “Progressive Platform for the People.” As a teacher at Sam Houston High School on the east side of San Antonio, Rick has seen what happens when our children are abandoned by DC politicians. As Secretary of the Bexar County Democratic Party, he led the local fight against the Trans-Pacific Partnership, a disastrous trade deal that would've hurt jobs at home and the environment. He has also led the local fight against Chained CPI, a proposal aimed to cut Social Security and Disabled Veteran’s benefits. Rick has never been afraid to confront the injustice that takes place in Washington and he will continue that fight to D.C.

”As a teacher I saw everyday the struggles of working families. I saw students turn their back on their dreams because they couldn’t afford college. I saw students over a course of a year lose weight because he didn’t have food at home. And, I lost students to violence in the community. We need a living wage now!” - Rick Trevino

Help us spread the message about Rick Trevino’s mission to bring real change to Texas and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Rick Trevino’s story, click or tap here.

metafields.value: James is a civil rights lawyer who pulled himself out of poverty and homeless through hard work, education, and service as an Army infantryman in the Presidential Honor Guard. He has fought against homelessness and for equality for all in the working class communities of his district throughout his entire career. James is bringing that tireless energy to his campaign against a vulnerable incumbent who is bought and paid by the Koch brothers.
metafields.title: Website Blurb

metafields.value:
VOTING INFORMATION 

District: KS-04
Primary Date: 8/7/2018
Primary Type: Party members and unaffiliated
Early Voting: Not Permitted
Voter Registration Deadline: 7/17/2018

“For me, jobs and education are the things that we need to be working on because people of all colors, all races, all religions - they want to be able to provide for their family, they want to provide a good education for their kids because they want their kids to go on and have a better life than they did. Taking care of those two issues right there. We've got to get back to this country back to being about the working-class family.” - James Thompson

Justice Democrats is proud of supporting candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, James Thompson fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people he would represent by replacing the incumbent and running on these important issues: 

  • Create a strong Kansas economy for working class families
  • Fight for the U.S. Constitution and rights for all Americans 
  • Defend DACA and a firm, fair immigration policy 
  • Defending Medicare for All and Social Security
  • Fight for Campaign Finance Reform
  • Reform Criminal Justice System and Policing
  • Combat homelessness  

James Thompson pulled himself out of his cycle of poverty and homelessness through education that he received through public school then onto the United States Army. James served in the Army as an infantryman in the Presidential Honor Guard. Following an honorable discharge, James moved to Kansas to be close to family and used his GI Bill to attend Wichita State University and Washburn University Law School. Now, he is a civil rights attorney in Wichita who is running for Congress because he knows the opportunities afforded to him helped change his life, and those opportunities need to be available to future generations. He believes our elected offices should ensure people up and down the economic ladder have the ability to build a better, brighter future for themselves and their children. Regardless of race, nation of origin, gender, religion, socioeconomic background or intellectual ability, James will fight for a better Kansas for all Kansans.

Help us spread the message about James Thompson's mission to bring real change to Kansas District-04 and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of James Thompson’s story, click or tap here.
metafields.title: Calling Prompt

metafields.value:
James Thompson Phone Banking Script

Introduction:

Hi! My name is __________________ and I’m a volunteer out today talking with voters about what issues are important to them. Do you have a few minutes to talk about your concerns?

If YES: Thank you - in your opinion, what is the most important issue facing the country today?

If NO: No worries...

Midterm Elections are on November 6th of this year. In our district, James Thompson and Ron Estes are running for U.S. Congress again. You may remember them from the Special Election - and if you don’t mind me asking:

Will you be voting for James Thompson or Ron Estes for U.S. Congress in November?

(click on result to jump to the next script section)

1 - STRONG Thompson
2 - LEAN Thompson
3 - UNDECIDED
4 - LEAN Opponent
 5 - STRONG Opponent
6 - LEAN Other
7 - STRONG Other
8 - NOT VOTING

Support 1 - 2

That's great! We are on the same page. We are working hard to spread the message about James’s effort to bring real change to Kansas and propel America forward. In this tough race we need as much help as possible. We are only going to win if we all stand up and help spread the word. (Click ‘Vol Events’ button below to show volunteer events)

If “yes” can volunteer: 

We have events coming up soon and we really need your help. (read events in the button above) We are [CALLING/KNOCKING ON DOORS/MEETING] on [EVENT DATES] at [EVENT TIMES].

Are you available to attend an upcoming event?

If YES can attend: Wonderful! Let’s sign you up for an upcoming event. (Click on the RSVP link for the event, Enter the voter’s information into the form and submit it.)

If NO cannot attend: That's ok; we have lots of events in the future and I'm sure we can find one that works for you! Let's get you on the volunteer list for now so our volunteer team can reach out to you for future events! [Sign up to volunteer form at the bottom of the events section].

If NO cannot volunteer: It’s alright - if you find time in the future, please visit www.votejamesthompson.com to get involved. You can also see everything we are doing on facebook, twitter, and instagram.

Thank you for your time and support for James - we look forward to having you join us soon, [voter name].

Undecided/Lean Opponent 3 - 4

It’s alright, our campaign is just getting started so you will have plenty of opportunities to get to know James Thompson over the next few months.

Personally, I support James because _____________ 

Example: Personally, I support James because he's a veteran and civil rights lawyer from a working class family who knows through experience how to stand up for a truly just democracy.

You can see more about James’s plans and the importance of this campaign on our website at www.votejamesthompson.com.

Thank you for your time.

DO NOT Support 5 - 6 - 7 - 8

Thank you for your time, we hope James Thompson can win your support in the future!

metafields.value: Dan is a civil rights attorney who has spent his career fighting for those who would not otherwise have a voice in the justice system. He was part of the team that successfully fought for marriage equality in all 50 states before the United States Supreme Court, and he represents victims of white supremacist violence incited by Donald Trump during the 2016 presidential campaign. Dan believes that healthcare is a basic human right, that the role of dark money in politics must come to an end, and that we must invest in the working class. When elected, he will be a voice for all – not just a select few.
metafields.title: Website Blurb

metafields.value:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: Indiana, 9th
Primary Date: 05/08/2018
Primary Type: Mixed Primary
Voter Registration Deadline: 04/09/18

”But this election can’t be about who I am, who my opponent is, or how much money we’ve raised. This election has to be about issues. We have to discuss the problems that really matter to Hoosiers, and offer sound solutions to those problems.” - Dan Canon

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Dan Canon fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people he would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting to:

  • Regard universal healthcare as a necessity and a right for all people
  • Strengthen and raise Social Security benefits
  • Implement an immediate and varied strategy to address the opioid crisis
  • Support for the Automatic Voter Registration Act (H.B. 2840)
  • Demand comprehensive environmental protections
  • Break up monopolies and make Wall Street billionaires pay their fair share 
  • Encourage renegotiation of trade deals and improve consumer protections

Dan is a civil rights attorney who has spent his career fighting for those who would not otherwise have a voice in the justice system. He was part of the team that successfully fought for marriage equality in all 50 states before the United States Supreme Court, and he represents victims of white supremacist violence incited by Donald Trump during the 2016 presidential campaign. Dan believes that healthcare is a basic human right, that the role of dark money in politics must come to an end, and that we must invest in the working class. When elected, he will be a voice for all – not just a select few.

”Through my personal and professional experiences, I have come to believe that America’s strength is not in our government, our corporations, or our wealth, but in our people.” - Dan Canon

Help us spread the message about Dan Canon’s mission to bring real change to Indiana and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Dan Canon’s story, click or tap here.
metafields.title: Calling Prompt

metafields.value:
Dan Canon Phone Banking Script

Hi, is _________ available?

My name is __________________ I’m a volunteer with Dan Canon who is running for Congress.

Dan has served his community as a civil rights attorney in Southern Indiana and Louisville, and has lived in Southern Indiana for the last 30 years. Throughout his career as an attorney, Dan has provided a voice to the voiceless by representing hundreds of people against powerful corporate and government interests. As Congressman, Dan will listen, carry your concerns to Washington, and make sure YOUR voice is heard.

Since you care about our community and the future of Southern Indiana, I hope Dan can count on your support. In the 2018 Democratic Primary, can Dan Canon count on your support in his bid for Congress here in the 9th Congressional District?

(click on result to jump to the next script section)

1 - STRONG Canon
2 - LEAN Canon
3 - UNDECIDED
4 - LEAN Opponent
 5 - STRONG Opponent
6 - LEAN Other
7 - STRONG Other
8 - NOT VOTING

Support 1 - 2

That’s great! We are on the same page. We are working hard to spread the message about Dan's mission to bring real change to Indiana 9th and to America. With only a few months left to organize, we need as much help as possible.

Dan strongly believes we need to engage our neighbors to get involved and vote in the election. Can we count on you to engage your neighborhood? 

If YES can volunteer: Awesome! We have events coming up soon and we really need your help! I will mark you down here and someone from the campaign will be in touch shortly!  [Record as "1 - Strong Support-Vol Yes" or "2 - Lean Support - Vol Yes"]

NO cannot volunteer: It’s alright - if you find time in the future, please visit canonforindiana.com to get involved. You can also see everything we are doing on facebook, twitter, and instagram.Can I send you a text with links to our website or social media so you can give us a like or follow?

Thank you for your time and support for Dan - we look forward to having you join us soon, [voter name].

Undecided 3

I understand being undecided, and hope Dan can earn your support. To best serve his fellow Hoosiers, Dan truly believes this campaign is about listening to the concerns of Hoosiers and their families.

Out of these following issues, can you pick one which is most important to you?

Jobs and Economy
Healthcare
Government Transparency
Education
Environment
Other

 [Record as "3 - Undecided - ISSUE"]

Personally, I support Dan because _____________

[SAMPLE EXAMPLE] I’m supporting Dan because I want to send a progressive to Congress who will fight for issues I care about like Universal health care and making the American economy work for working families.

You can see more about Dan’s plans and the importance of this campaign on our website at canonforindiana.com.

Do you want me to send you a text with links to Dan’s website or social media so you can find out more information? 

Thank you for your time.

DO NOT Support 4 - 5 - 6 - 7 - 8

Thank you for your time, we hope Dan Canon can win your support in the future!

metadata.calling_prompt:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: Indiana, 9th
Primary Date: 05/08/2018
Primary Type: Mixed Primary
Voter Registration Deadline: 04/09/18

”But this election can’t be about who I am, who my opponent is, or how much money we’ve raised. This election has to be about issues. We have to discuss the problems that really matter to Hoosiers, and offer sound solutions to those problems.” - Dan Canon

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Dan Canon fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people he would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting to:

  • Regard universal healthcare as a necessity and a right for all people
  • Strengthen and raise Social Security benefits
  • Implement an immediate and varied strategy to address the opioid crisis
  • Support for the Automatic Voter Registration Act (H.B. 2840)
  • Demand comprehensive environmental protections
  • Break up monopolies and make Wall Street billionaires pay their fair share 
  • Encourage renegotiation of trade deals and improve consumer protections

Dan is a civil rights attorney who has spent his career fighting for those who would not otherwise have a voice in the justice system. He was part of the team that successfully fought for marriage equality in all 50 states before the United States Supreme Court, and he represents victims of white supremacist violence incited by Donald Trump during the 2016 presidential campaign. Dan believes that healthcare is a basic human right, that the role of dark money in politics must come to an end, and that we must invest in the working class. When elected, he will be a voice for all – not just a select few.

”Through my personal and professional experiences, I have come to believe that America’s strength is not in our government, our corporations, or our wealth, but in our people.” - Dan Canon

Help us spread the message about Dan Canon’s mission to bring real change to Indiana and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Dan Canon’s story, click or tap here.

metafields.value: Kaniela is a Native Hawaiian and Progressive State Representative with a history of successful grassroots campaigns based on big, progressive ideas. At age 22, he beat a Tea-Party Republican, despite getting outspent 10-1 by personally knocking on 15k doors. Now he is running for Congress in Hawaii’s 1st district on the boldest platform Hawaii has ever seen.
metafields.title: Website Blurb

metafields.value:
VOTING INFORMATION

State: Hawaii-01
Primary Date: 08/11/2018
Primary Type: Open Primary

”I was in a Republican district, running on a progressive platform, but I couldn't stand by while the tea-party incumbent sold-out our islands. So I personally knocked on 15,000 doors. I walked my neighborhood from noon to sunset, after working a full-time sunrise shift cleaning locker rooms at a nearby resort. It was an uphill battle, but people could relate to my grassroots message... We were outspent-10-to-1, but still won by a huge 26 percent.” - Kaniela Ing

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Kaniela Ing fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people he would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting for:

  • Medicare-for-All 
  • More affordable housing for our Kupuna
  • Raising the living wage and universal basic income
  • Big money out of politics
  • Tuition-free higher education and college 
  • 100% renewable energy economy by 2035
  • An infrastructure plan for working-class people, not international wealthy elites
  • Eliminating the for-profit prison system
  • Environmental protection measures
  • Unionize workers rights and bring more jobs
  • Native Hawaiian issues and concerns
  • Expanding social security
  • GMO-labeling and pesticides 

Kaniela was born and raised in Hawaii and attended Kamehameha Schools Maui, Maui Community College, the University of Hawaii at Manoa, and American University in Washington D.C. He served as UH student-body president, as a neighborhood board member, and has worked in various capacities with Hawaii's business, government, and the non-profit sectors prior to assuming public office. He’s now the Majority Policy Leader. His first job was at 14 yo in the pineapple fields to help his family pay the bills. Kaniela is a local boy and fights for working families because he comes from one. He was elected to serve the 11th House District (South Maui: Kihei, Wailea, Makena) as a 23-year-old first-time candidate in 2012. Kaniela was widely considered an underdog based on fundraising, name recognition, and countless of hours of grassroots voter outreach. He was was re-elected in the 2014 primary and general elections. In 2016, he faced Primary challenger, Deidre Tegarden and prevailed with 61% of the vote to his opponent's 34%. He has been a constant voice for this district and will continue doing so in Washington against big money special interests who sell out our people for profit.

”I have always put people over profits. We took on corporate polluters, special interest lobbyists, and even billionaires. I quickly rose up the ranks to become Majority Policy Leader, setting ‍‍ legislative priorities statewide. We expanded voting access, women’s equality, LGBTQ rights, environmental protections, gun safety, and more. Now, I’m taking this grassroots, progressive energy from Hawaii to Washington D.C.” - Kaniela Ing

Help us spread the message about Kaniela mission to bring real change to Hawaii and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Kaniela’s story, click or tap here.

metafields.value: New York’s 14th congressional district urgently needs access to more reliable jobs, increased access to family support services like parental leave and free childcare. I will fight for universal access to quality education from pre-K until college regardless of income and enrollment status because your ZIP code should never determine your quality of life.
metafields.title: Short Story

metafields.value:
VOTING INFORMATION 

District: New York,14th
Primary Date: Spring 2018 - TBA
Primary Type: must be registered as a "Democrat" to vote
Voter Registration Deadline: 10/13/2017

“Serving, bartending, and helping manage a local business has ranked among the best educational experiences of my life. The fact is, much public policy is all talk until you’ve worked 18-hour days to make ends meet. Doing that, and having the experience of a working person, we begin to truly understand the real-life impact of healthcare policy, labor laws, living wage, and so on. This is how I realized how far D.C. has strayed from everyday Americans." - Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez 

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people she would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting to: 

  • Ensure universal access to quality education regardless of income
  • Make early childhood education available to all children during critical years of learning
  • Reform our broken criminal justice system 
  • Invest in our healthcare system and make it accessible 
  • Create clean energy jobs and bring them to New York

Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez is a veteran organizer, advocate, and entrepreneur. In her career she has helped women in the developing world obtain small business loans, trained Latino youth to be future business leaders, and advocated for working people. Her hard-working background and humble upbringing has given her the perspective she has today towards everyday Americans. She understands these struggles and will strive to ensure that their voices are brought to Congress with her.

“We are going to take our collective experiences and bring them to Washington to fight for an economy that empowers liberty and justice for all.” - Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez

Help us spread the message about Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez's mission to bring real change to New York and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez’s story, click or tap here.

metafields.title: Website Blurb

object.title: Alexandria Ocasio Script

metafields.value:
Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez Phone Banking Script

Introduction:

Hello, my name is______ may I please speak with __________?

Hi _______, my name is _______and I’m a volunteer with the Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez for Congress campaign.

Alexandria is a progressive Democrat endorsed by Brand New Congress and Justice Democrats because she is fighting for: [TALK ABOUT A FEW POINTS]

  • Tuition-free public college and trade school
  • Medicare for All with no out-of-pocket costs for anyone
  • A 100% renewable energy economy and reducing pollution to protect our children’s health
  • A just and sustainable recovery for Puerto Rico including full debt forgiveness
  • End ‘Stop and Frisk’, stop the school-to-prison pipeline, and protect due process
  • Family leave and childcare support to help working families get by

Can Alexandria count on your support and vote in New Yorks’ Democratic primary for Congress in 2018?

(click on result to jump to the next script section)

1 - STRONG Ocasio
2 - LEAN Ocasio
3 - UNDECIDED
4 - LEAN Opponent
 5 - STRONG Opponent
6 - LEAN Other
7 - STRONG Other
8 - NOT VOTING

Support 1 - 2

That's great! We are on the same page. We are working hard to spread the message about Alexandria’s mission to bring real change to New York's 14th and to America. With only a few months left to organize, we need as much help as possible.

We are only going to win if we all stand up and help spread the word. Are you available to help knock on doors or make calls to voters just like I am doing right now?

If “yes” can volunteer: 

Awesome! We have events coming up soon that we really need your help on. We are [CALLING/TEXTING/MEETING] on [EVENT DATE] at [EVENT TIME]. Can we count on you to join us?


If YES can attend: That's great! [Click on RSVP button and RSVP the volunteer to the specific event] You will should receive a confirmation email shortly and a local organizer will reach out to confirm and answer any questions over the next few days. Thank you for your time and support for Alexandria - we look forward to having you join us soon, [voter name].

If NO can't attend: That's ok we have lots of events in the future and I'm sure we can find one that works for you! Let's get you on the volunteer list for now and then someone will reach out as we add more volunteer events to the list. [Sign up to volunteer form at the bottom of the events section] Thank you for your time and support for Alexandria - we look forward to having you join us soon, [voter name].

If “no” cannot volunteer It’s alright - if you find time in the future, please visit ocasio2018.com to get involved. You can also see everything we are doing on our facebook, twitter, and instagram. 

Can I send you a text with links to our website or social media so you can give us a like or follow?


Thank you for your time and support for Alexandria - we look forward to having you join us soon, [voter name].

Undecided/Lean Opponent 3 - 4

It’s alright, the election is just getting started so you will have plenty of opportunities to get to know Alexandria Ocasio over the next few months.

Personally, I support Alexandria because _____________ 

Sample Text:  Alexandria is someone who understands and has lived through the socio-economic struggle many of us face, especially in the Bronx. She believes that it’s wrong that a child could be educationally disadvantaged simply due to the zip code in which they were born. It doesn't stop at schools, either -- healthcare, worker protections, and solid jobs are all part of the equation for prosperous communities. She’s dedicated to expanding economic opportunity for working and middle class Americans in New York and beyond.

You can see more about Alexandria's plans and the importance of this campaign on our website @ ocasio2018.com 

Do you want me to send you a text with links to Alexandria's website or social media so you can find out more information? 


Thank you for your time, [voter name].

DO NOT Support 5 - 6 - 7 - 8

Thank you for your time, we hope we can win your support in the future, [voter name]!

metadata.website_blurb: New York's 14th congressional district urgently needs access to more reliable jobs, increased access to family support services like parental leave and free childcare. I will fight for universal access to quality...
metadata.short_story: New York’s 14th congressional district urgently needs access to more reliable jobs, increased access to family support services like parental leave and free childcare. I will fight for universal access to quality education from pre-K until college regardless of income and enrollment status because your ZIP code should never determine your quality of life.

metadata.calling_prompt:
VOTING INFORMATION 

District: New York,14th
Primary Date: Spring 2018 - TBA
Primary Type: must be registered as a "Democrat" to vote
Voter Registration Deadline: 10/13/2017

“Serving, bartending, and helping manage a local business has ranked among the best educational experiences of my life. The fact is, much public policy is all talk until you’ve worked 18-hour days to make ends meet. Doing that, and having the experience of a working person, we begin to truly understand the real-life impact of healthcare policy, labor laws, living wage, and so on. This is how I realized how far D.C. has strayed from everyday Americans." - Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez 

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people she would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting to: 

  • Ensure universal access to quality education regardless of income
  • Make early childhood education available to all children during critical years of learning
  • Reform our broken criminal justice system 
  • Invest in our healthcare system and make it accessible 
  • Create clean energy jobs and bring them to New York

Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez is a veteran organizer, advocate, and entrepreneur. In her career she has helped women in the developing world obtain small business loans, trained Latino youth to be future business leaders, and advocated for working people. Her hard-working background and humble upbringing has given her the perspective she has today towards everyday Americans. She understands these struggles and will strive to ensure that their voices are brought to Congress with her.

“We are going to take our collective experiences and bring them to Washington to fight for an economy that empowers liberty and justice for all.” - Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez

Help us spread the message about Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez's mission to bring real change to New York and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez’s story, click or tap here.

metafields.value: Kara Eastman is a longtime community leader running for Congress in Nebraska’s 2nd District. As the founder of the Omaha Healthy Kids Alliance, Kara led the charge to combat lead poisoning in children and ensure access to safe, green affordable housing. We know we can count on Kara to continue to fight for our shared values in Washington.

metafields.value: Antoinette Sedillo is a 14th generation, lifelong New Mexican who leads an anti-domestic violence non-profit that serves all and focuses outreach efforts in the Latino immigrant community of Central New Mexico. She is a law professor with know-how to bring sound policy change to Congress, and advocate for the civil and political rights of Americans.
metafields.title: Website Blurb

metafields.value:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: New Mexico, 1st District
Primary Date: 06/06/2018
Primary Type: Closed

”I know what it’s like to be discounted, dismissed, and discriminated against. I’ve never tolerated that personally, nor in my community, and won’t tolerate it now. I will be a voice in Congress fighting back against discrimination and hate to break down barriers and to create opportunities for everyone to succeed.”  -  Antoinette Sedillo Lopez 

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Antoinette Sedillo Lopez fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people she would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting for:

  • Healthcare for all
  • An economy that supports workers, families, and small businesses
  • Climate justice and a New Energy Economy 
  • Immigration rights and the Clean Dream Act
  • Debt-free education and on-job training
  • Gun control and background checks 

Antoinette Sedillo Lopez most recently served as the executive director of Enlace Communitario, an anti-domestic violence non-profit that serves all and focuses outreach efforts in the Latino immigrant community of Central New Mexico. Prior to her role at Enlace, she served as a Law Professor at UNM for over 27 years, including eight years as Associate Dean of UNM’s Clinical Law program. In this role she supervised law students in serving low income clients in a variety of settings. Antoinette’s leadership in legal education and on critical social and civil rights issues has earned her numerous awards and national recognition. Antoinette grew up on her parents’ farm in Los Chavez, New Mexico. After graduating, Antoinette pursued her dream of becoming an attorney, enrolling and excelling first at UNM and then at UCLA School of Law where she met her husband Victor. As a 14th generation and life-long New Mexican, Antoinette has deep roots in the state. She has been closely involved with numerous organizations in her community including serving on the boards of the New Mexico Coalition Against Domestic Violence, Valley Improvement Association Board, Bernalillo County/City of Albuquerque Air Quality Control Board, the Southwest Women’s Law Center, and the New Mexico Hispanic Bar Association. Antoinette is building a broad coalition of support rooted in her decades of service to communities throughout the district. She is running a strong, progressive, inclusive, and results-oriented campaign to ensure our voice is heard in Congress.

”With the election of our current President, our communities are losing out. We are moving backwards as a nation, not forward. I am running for Congress to stop this backward governance. I will fight for opportunities for all New Mexicans.” -  Antoinette Sedillo Lopez 

Help us spread the message about Antoinette’s mission to bring real change to New Mexico and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Antoinette Sedillo Lopez’ story, click or tap here.
metafields.title: Calling Prompt

metafields.value:
Antoinette Sedillo Lopez Phone Banking Script

Introduction:

Hello, is [voter name] available? 

My name is __________, and I’m a fellow precinct chair, and I’m calling on behalf of with Antoinette Sedillo Lopez’ campaign for congress. Are you familiar with Antoinette Sedillo Lopez?

If NO: Antoinette Sedillo Lopez is a community leader focused on the social, economic, environmental, and civil rights issues impacting the lives of all New Mexicans. A lifelong New Mexican, she was the first Latina tenured law professor at UNM, where she served for more than twenty-five years, including eight years as an Associate Dean. Most recently, she was the executive director of the non-profit Enlace Comunitario, where she worked to end domestic violence in our state. Previously, she was the President of the Southwest Women’s Law Center, a member of the Albuquerque Air Quality Control Board, and currently sits on the board of MALDEF (a Latino civil rights organization).

If YES: (move onto the next question)

Can Antoinette Sedillo Lopez count on your vote during New Mexico’s Democratic primary on June 5th?

(click on result to jump to the next script section)

1 - STRONG Lopez
2 - LEAN Lopez
3 - UNDECIDED
4 - LEAN Opponent
 5 - STRONG Opponent
6 - LEAN Other
7 - STRONG Other
8 - NOT VOTING

Support 1 - 2

Great! That's very helpful to us. We're working hard to spread our message and we only have a few weeks left in order to organize the entire district and get the real change we need, so your help is really valuable. If we all step up, we can win this. Are you available to help knock on doors or make calls to voters just like I am doing right now?

If YES, can volunteer: Awesome! We have events that will be coming up soon - in the meantime, I’m going to sign you up to be on her volunteer list so someone from the campaign will be in touch shortly! (click button below and sign them up as a volunteer)

If NO, cannot volunteer: Alright - if you find time in the future, please visit antoinetteforcongress.com to get involved. You can also see everything we are doing on our Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.

Can I send you a text with links to our website or social media so you can give us a like or follow? We want you to stay updated with the campaign!

If YES: Great! (Click on button below and fill out form for them)

If NO: (move on with to next part...)

Thank you for your time and support for Antoinette - we look forward to having you join us soon, [voter name].

Undecided/Lean Opponent 3 - 4

It’s alright, our campaign is just getting started so you will have plenty of opportunities to get to know Antoinette over the next few months.

Personally, I support Antoinette because _____________

 EXAMPLE:

Antoinette is a true progressive with a proven track record of fighting for New Mexican families, as her expertise in the rule of law and years of community involvement exceptionally qualify her to serve in Congress for New Mexico’s 1st Congressional District.

Do you want me to send you a text with links to Antoinette's website or social media so you can find out more information? 

If YES: Great! (click on button below and fill out form for them)

If NO: (move on to next part...)

You can see more about Antoinette’s plans and the importance of this campaign on our website at antoinetteforcongress.com

Thank you for your time, we hope Antoinette can win your support.

DO NOT Support 5 - 6 - 7 - 8

Thank you for your time, [voter name], we hope Antoinette Sedillo Lopez can win your support in the future!

metadata.calling_prompt:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: New Mexico, 1st District
Primary Date: 06/06/2018
Primary Type: Closed

”I know what it’s like to be discounted, dismissed, and discriminated against. I’ve never tolerated that personally, nor in my community, and won’t tolerate it now. I will be a voice in Congress fighting back against discrimination and hate to break down barriers and to create opportunities for everyone to succeed.”  -  Antoinette Sedillo Lopez 

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Antoinette Sedillo Lopez fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people she would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting for:

  • Healthcare for all
  • An economy that supports workers, families, and small businesses
  • Climate justice and a New Energy Economy 
  • Immigration rights and the Clean Dream Act
  • Debt-free education and on-job training
  • Gun control and background checks 

Antoinette Sedillo Lopez most recently served as the executive director of Enlace Communitario, an anti-domestic violence non-profit that serves all and focuses outreach efforts in the Latino immigrant community of Central New Mexico. Prior to her role at Enlace, she served as a Law Professor at UNM for over 27 years, including eight years as Associate Dean of UNM’s Clinical Law program. In this role she supervised law students in serving low income clients in a variety of settings. Antoinette’s leadership in legal education and on critical social and civil rights issues has earned her numerous awards and national recognition. Antoinette grew up on her parents’ farm in Los Chavez, New Mexico. After graduating, Antoinette pursued her dream of becoming an attorney, enrolling and excelling first at UNM and then at UCLA School of Law where she met her husband Victor. As a 14th generation and life-long New Mexican, Antoinette has deep roots in the state. She has been closely involved with numerous organizations in her community including serving on the boards of the New Mexico Coalition Against Domestic Violence, Valley Improvement Association Board, Bernalillo County/City of Albuquerque Air Quality Control Board, the Southwest Women’s Law Center, and the New Mexico Hispanic Bar Association. Antoinette is building a broad coalition of support rooted in her decades of service to communities throughout the district. She is running a strong, progressive, inclusive, and results-oriented campaign to ensure our voice is heard in Congress.

”With the election of our current President, our communities are losing out. We are moving backwards as a nation, not forward. I am running for Congress to stop this backward governance. I will fight for opportunities for all New Mexicans.” -  Antoinette Sedillo Lopez 

Help us spread the message about Antoinette’s mission to bring real change to New Mexico and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Antoinette Sedillo Lopez’ story, click or tap here.

metafields.value: The people of Missouri's 1st district need a representative who understands their struggles and will fight for real solutions. Cori Bush is a former teacher, a registered nurse and a pastor. She's a single mother and an engaged citizen. More importantly, she's a fighter. This is not the time for baby steps. Incremental change is no change at all when families are struggling to put food on the table or find justice in the streets. Cori is running to bring transformative change to St. Louis and all of Missouri's 1st. Stand with Cori, because she stands by you.
metafields.title: Short Story

metafields.value:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: MO-01
Primary Date: 8/7/2018
Primary Type: Open
Early Voting: In-person absentee; mail-In
Voter Registration Deadline: 7/11/2018

When Cori Bush talks about jobs, justice and opportunity rather than tear gas and tanks, it's because she worked a dead-end job and watched tanks roll through the streets of her city. She will walk into the U.S. Capitol in 2018 carrying with her the months she spent homeless, the children she raised as a single mother, and the mental health patients she has served who can't afford medication. She will bring with her the assault she suffered while protesting injustice out in the streets with the people. 

As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, she fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people she would represent by replacing the incumbent:   

  • Replacing the school-to-prison pipeline with a school-to-prosperity pipeline
  • Medicare for all and truly affordable medication
  • Raising the federal minimum wage to $15
  • Fighting for workers rights, strong unions, and job training 

When she says St. Louis needs new leadership, everyone listening knows she's right - to us, her supporters, it's obvious this leadership should be her. Justice Democrats and Brand New Congress are proud of supporting candidates like her with a positive vision for our future. 

Help us spread the message about Cori Bush's mission to bring real change to Missouri District-01 and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Cori’s story, click or tap here.

metafields.value:
Cori Bush Phone Banking Script

Introduction:

Hello, my name is______ may I please speak with __________?

Hi _______, my name is _______and I’m a volunteer with the Cori Bush for US Congress campaign.

Cori is a progressive Democrat endorsed by Brand New Congress because she is fighting for:

  • Replacing the school-to-prison pipeline with a school-to-prosperity pipeline
  • Medicare for all and affordable medication
  • Raising the federal minimum wage to $15
  • Workers rights & basic job training

Can Cori count on your support and vote in Missouri’s Democratic primary for Congress in 2018?

(click on result to jump to the next script section)

1 - STRONG Cori Bush
2 - LEAN Cori Bush 
3 - UNDECIDED
4 - LEAN Opponent
 5 - STRONG Opponent
6 - LEAN Other
7 - STRONG Other
8 - NOT VOTING

Support 1 - 2

That's great! We are on the same page. We are working hard to spread the message about Cori’s mission to bring real change to Missouri's 1st and to America. With only a few months left to organize, we need as much help as possible.

We are only going to win if we all stand up and help spread the word. Will you help make calls to voters just like I am doing right now? We will provide you guides, training, and live support to make sure you have a great experience and make a real difference in these congressional races, no matter your location or ability. All you’ll need is a laptop, microphone headphones/headset, and wifi. 

If “yes” can volunteer: Awesome! Let me sign you up for an upcoming call shift! (go to jdems.us/call and sign them up for a call shift!). 

Depending on your availability, you will select your available date(s), fill out this form with your information, and be sent a reminder before your scheduled call time via email and text message. A member from our dialer team will give you a call and make sure you feel ready. 

If “no” cannot volunteer It’s alright - if you find time in the future, please visit votecoribush.com to get involved or visit events.brandnewcongress.org to find an event near you!

Thank you for your time and support for Cori - we look forward to having you join us soon, [voter name].

Undecided/Lean Opponent 3 - 4

It’s alright, our campaign is just getting started so you will have plenty of opportunities to get to know Cori Bush over the next few months.

Personally, I support Cori because _____________ 

Sample Text: When she talks about jobs and opportunity rather than tear gas and tanks, it's because she worked a dead-end job and watched tanks roll through the streets of her city. She will walk into the U.S. Capitol in 2018 carrying with her the months she spent homeless, the children she raised as a single-mother, the patients she has served who can't afford medication and the assault she suffered while protesting injustice out in the streets - all the while moving forward resiliently with her head held high. When she says St. Louis needs new leadership, everyone listening knows she's right - to us, her supporters like myself, it's obvious this leadership should be her. Cori is going represent the people in our community and not big corporations or Wall Street.

I can tell you that I’m supporting Cori Bush because she has been a hard-working woman who has first-hand witnessed the struggles Americans go through and wishes to finally address those concerns in Washington.

You can see more about Cori's plans and the importance of this campaign on our website @ votecoribush.com

Thank you for your time, [voter name].

(back to top)

DO NOT Support 5 - 6 - 7 - 8

Thank you for your time, we hope we can win your support in the future, [voter name]!

(back to top)

All you’ll need is a laptop, microphone headphones/headset, and wifi. 

If “yes” can volunteer: Awesome! Let me sign you up for an upcoming call shift! (go to jdems.us/call and sign them up for a call shift!). 

Depending on your availability, you will select your available date(s), fill out this form with your information, and be sent a reminder before your scheduled call time via email and text message. A member from our dialer team will give you a call and make sure you feel ready. 

If “no” cannot volunteer It’s alright - if you find time in the future, please visit votecoribush.com to get involved or get more information.You can also see everything we are doing on our facebook, twitter, and instagram. 

Can I send you a text with links to our website or social media so you can give us a like or follow?

Thank you for your time and support for Cori - we look forward to having you join us soon, [voter name].

Undecided/Lean Opponent 3 - 4

It’s alright, our campaign is just getting started so you will have plenty of opportunities to get to know Cori Bush over the next few months.

Personally, I support Cori because _____________ 

Sample Text: When she talks about jobs and opportunity rather than tear gas and tanks, it's because she worked a dead-end job and watched tanks roll through the streets of her city. She will walk into the U.S. Capitol in 2018 carrying with her the months she spent homeless, the children she raised as a single-mother, the patients she has served who can't afford medication and the assault she suffered while protesting injustice out in the streets - all the while moving forward resiliently with her head held high. When she says St. Louis needs new leadership, everyone listening knows she's right - to us, her supporters like myself, it's obvious this leadership should be her. Cori is going represent the people in our community and not big corporations or Wall Street.

I can tell you that I’m supporting Cori Bush because she has been a hard-working woman who has first-hand witnessed the struggles Americans go through and wishes to finally address those concerns in Washington.

Do you want me to send you a text with links to Cori's website or social media so you can find out more information? 

You can see more about Cori's plans and the importance of this campaign on our website @ votecoribush.com

Thank you for your time, [voter name].

(back to top)

DO NOT Support 5 - 6 - 7 - 8

Thank you for your time, we hope we can win your support in the future, [voter name]!

(back to top)

metadata.calling_prompt:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: MO-01
Primary Date: 8/7/2018
Primary Type: Open
Early Voting: In-person absentee; mail-In
Voter Registration Deadline: 7/11/2018

When Cori Bush talks about jobs, justice and opportunity rather than tear gas and tanks, it's because she worked a dead-end job and watched tanks roll through the streets of her city. She will walk into the U.S. Capitol in 2018 carrying with her the months she spent homeless, the children she raised as a single mother, and the mental health patients she has served who can't afford medication. She will bring with her the assault she suffered while protesting injustice out in the streets with the people. 

As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, she fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people she would represent by replacing the incumbent:   

  • Replacing the school-to-prison pipeline with a school-to-prosperity pipeline
  • Medicare for all and truly affordable medication
  • Raising the federal minimum wage to $15
  • Fighting for workers rights, strong unions, and job training 

When she says St. Louis needs new leadership, everyone listening knows she's right - to us, her supporters, it's obvious this leadership should be her. Justice Democrats and Brand New Congress are proud of supporting candidates like her with a positive vision for our future. 

Help us spread the message about Cori Bush's mission to bring real change to Missouri District-01 and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Cori’s story, click or tap here.

Together we will secure healthcare as a human right through Medicare for All, end mass incarceration, and ensure the right to an education with free public college.

metadata.signup_prompt: Join me in creating a Brand New Congress

metafields.value: Laura Moser is a working mom turned progressive activist turned candidate for Congress in TX-07. She believes that healthcare is a right and not a privilege; that the economy of the richest country in the world can benefit everyone; that a good education should be available to every child; that every worker deserves a living wage; and that caring for the environment is a matter of life and death.
metafields.title: Website Blurb

metafields.value:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: Texas’ 7th District
Primary Date: 03/06/2018
Primary Type: Party Members and Unaffiliated

”In the face of Hurricane Harvey, we witnessed the heroism and resilience of our city. It showed us how much solidarity and kindness exists among the regular people of Houston, and urged us to reject divisiveness and stand up for the values of decency and respect. We can’t hand our country over to those who are intent on driving Americans apart.” - Laura Moser

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Laura fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people he would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting for:

  • Federal tax dollars for flood preparedness in Houston and Harris County
  • A living wage, small businesses, and working-class families
  • Campaign Finance Reform 
  • Tuition-Free Community College and equitable education regardless of zipcode
  • Access to healthcare for everyone
  • Comprehensive immigration reform and a Clean DREAM Act
  • Ending the racist “War on Drugs” and amnesty for people convicted under marijuana laws 
  • Eliminating the private prison industry and its profit with mass incarceration
  • Enforcing civil rights protections for our marginalized communities

Laura Moser is a leader and organizer, which is how she’ll win against John Culberson. Following the 2016 election, she founded Daily Action, a text-messaging service that allows people to engage directly in the political process. Daily Action has tapped into demand from 300,000 people to take direct political action daily all over the country. Daily Action has notched real victories, like pressuring the House GOP to walk back their plans to gut the Congressional Ethics Office. Daily Action members also placed a record number of calls to senators regarding Trump’s terrible choice for Secretary of Labor, who eventually withdrew his name from consideration. Daily Action callers have led the fight against the repeal of Obamacare: The service connected more than a quarter of a million calls to protect the Affordable Care Act. With her experience, Laura will be able to organize and lead the fight in Washington, too.

”It’s time to stand up proudly for the values we share. For the values of decency and respect that are the values of the majority of Americans. For the people who think that healthcare is a right and not a privilege; that the economy of the richest country in the world can benefit everyone; that a good education should be available to every child; that every worker deserves a living wage; that caring for the environment is a matter of life and death. We’re the Americans who reject racism and believe in treating women and immigrants and LGBT people with respect. We’re the majority of this country. And we deserve a Congress that reflects our values.” - Laura Moser

Help us spread the message about Laura’s mission to bring real change to Texas’ 7th District and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Laura Moser’s story, click or tap here.

In Congress he will fight for Medicare For All, a living wage at $15/hour, combatting racism, and campaign finance reform.

metafields.title: Website Blurb

metafields.value:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: New York, 21st District
Primary Date: 06/26/2018
Primary Type: Closed

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Patrick Nelson fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people he would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting to:

  • Save the internet through Net Neutrality
  • Sustain debt-free higher education and job training programs
  • Improve and expand Medicare-for-All 
  • Achieve a living wage for everyone
  • Invest in North County infrastructure and world class rural abroad
  • End the prejudice and propaganda behind the War on Drugs

Patrick made the decision to dedicate his life to public service in 2011 before entering his senior year at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute (RPI), where he studied Biochemistry and Biophysics. He realized that at a time when science and technology is becoming a greater part of our daily lives, that there is a need for lawmakers that are literate in these areas. For the past several years, Patrick has been a grassroots activist and was elected as a Delegate for Sen. Bernie Sanders’ 2016 Presidential Campaign. He offers a bold vision for the future of New York’s North Country and the future of our nation. Together, we’re going to build a new model of open and transparent government based upon dialogue and not demagoguery. If you believe that America should be run for the people then join our campaign. You can rest assured I will give every ounce of my strength and energy to be the best Congressional Representative I can be. He has seen first-hand the failures of the Democratic Establishment and is committed to building a new model for campaigning and public service. 

”It’s time to stop the dysfunction, immaturity, and procrastination in Washington. It’s time to pass the Dream Act, fund CHIP for a full 10 years, provide for disaster relief, provide treatment for addicts, and give our armed services certainty in their funding by passing a damn budget instead of continuing resolutions that keep our government running just weeks away from another potential shutdown.” - Patrick Nelson

Help us spread the message about Patrick’s mission to bring real change to New York and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Patrick Nelson’s story, click or tap here.
metafields.title: Calling Prompt

metafields.value:
Patrick Nelson Phone Banking Script

Introduction:

Hello, my name is______ may I please speak with __________? 

Hi _______, my name is _______ and I’m a volunteer with Patrick Nelson who is running for Congress in New York’s 21st district. Patrick is a former Bernie (Sanders) delegate running against Elise Stefanik to get money out of politics. 

Have you heard of Patrick Nelson? 

If NO: Patrick is running as a grassroots candidate for New York’s 21st congressional district. He relies on small dollar donations to support his campaign, is in support of medicare-for-all, the fight for a $15 minimum wage, and for responsible action on climate change.Patrick is a product of public schools, a proud North Country resident of Stillwater New York, and has been a progressive organizer for the last 4 years, knocking on thousands of doors in the 21st district in the process. Most recently, Patrick has worked as a Special Projects Coordinator in the New York State Assembly. Patrick has both the campaign experience needed to win this election, and the sense of community needed to represent New York’s North Country in Washington.

If YES: (move onto the next question)

Leading into the primary, You will only be able to sign one nominating petition. Will you wait and hold your signature for Patrick’s?

(click on result to jump to the next script section)

1 - STRONG Nelson
2 - LEAN Nelson
3 - UNDECIDED
4 - LEAN Opponent
 5 - STRONG Opponent
6 - LEAN Other
7 - STRONG Other
8 - NOT VOTING

Support 1 - 2

Great! That's very helpful to us. We're working hard to spread our message and we only have a few weeks left in order to organize the entire district and get the real change we need, so your help is really valuable. If we all step up, we can win this. Are you available to help knock on doors or make calls to voters just like I am doing right now?

If YES, can volunteer: Awesome! We have events that will be coming up soon - in the meantime, I’m going to sign you up to be on her volunteer list so someone from the campaign will be in touch shortly! (click button below and sign them up as a volunteer)

If NO, can't volunteer: Alright - if you find time in the future, please visit nelsonforny.com to get involved. You can also see everything we are doing on our facebook, twitter, and instagram.

Can I send you a text with links to our website or social media so you can give us a like or follow? We want you to stay updated with the campaign!

If YES: Great! (Click on button below and fill out form for them)

If NO: (move on to next part...)

Thank you for your time and support for Patrick - we look forward to having you join us soon, [voter name].

Undecided/Lean Opponent 3 - 4

It’s alright, our campaign is just getting started so you will have plenty of opportunities to get to know Patrick over the next few months.

Personally, I support Patrick because _____________

 EXAMPLES:

“Patrick Nelson is a breath of fresh air for the North Country. He offers a truly progressive platform for an area often thought to be conservative. As a lifelong resident of the 21st district and member of the St. Regis Mohawk Tribe, he's receptive to native values and issues that affect not just the reservation, but also the surrounding communities. If we can all come together as a district to unite around Nelson, we can truly accomplish anything neighbors and allies." - Cody Jock

"If you're looking for a congressional candidate who's intelligent, well-balanced, high morals/values, and mature beyond his age, look no further than Patrick Nelson." - Kathy Green

"It was wonderful to see a candidate show a genuine interest in our area. It's more than a district on a map; it is my home. As a North Country native, I care deeply about our communities. It is truly inspiring to see that Patrick Nelson cares about them too. I look forward to seeing Patrick Nelson on the ballot box and in the House." - Keith Mitchell

What issue is most important to you? Campaign finance, climate change, net neutrality, or all of them?

If issue stated:  (acknowledge their response and mark in agent desktop as just 3 - Undecided - [issue] )

If NO issue stated:  (acknowledge their response and mark in agent desktop as just 3 - Undecided)

Do you want me to send you a text with links to Patrick's website or social media so you can find out more information? 

If YES: Great! (click on button below and fill out form for them)

If NO: (move on to next part...) 

 

You can see more about Patrick’s plans and the importance of this campaign on our website at nelsonforny.com 

Thank you for your time, we hope Patrick can win your support.

DO NOT Support 5 - 6 - 7 - 8

Thank you for your time, [voter name], we hope Patrick Nelson can win your support in the future!

metadata.calling_prompt:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: New York, 21st District
Primary Date: 06/26/2018
Primary Type: Closed

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Patrick Nelson fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people he would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting to:

  • Save the internet through Net Neutrality
  • Sustain debt-free higher education and job training programs
  • Improve and expand Medicare-for-All 
  • Achieve a living wage for everyone
  • Invest in North County infrastructure and world class rural abroad
  • End the prejudice and propaganda behind the War on Drugs

Patrick made the decision to dedicate his life to public service in 2011 before entering his senior year at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute (RPI), where he studied Biochemistry and Biophysics. He realized that at a time when science and technology is becoming a greater part of our daily lives, that there is a need for lawmakers that are literate in these areas. For the past several years, Patrick has been a grassroots activist and was elected as a Delegate for Sen. Bernie Sanders’ 2016 Presidential Campaign. He offers a bold vision for the future of New York’s North Country and the future of our nation. Together, we’re going to build a new model of open and transparent government based upon dialogue and not demagoguery. If you believe that America should be run for the people then join our campaign. You can rest assured I will give every ounce of my strength and energy to be the best Congressional Representative I can be. He has seen first-hand the failures of the Democratic Establishment and is committed to building a new model for campaigning and public service. 

”It’s time to stop the dysfunction, immaturity, and procrastination in Washington. It’s time to pass the Dream Act, fund CHIP for a full 10 years, provide for disaster relief, provide treatment for addicts, and give our armed services certainty in their funding by passing a damn budget instead of continuing resolutions that keep our government running just weeks away from another potential shutdown.” - Patrick Nelson

Help us spread the message about Patrick’s mission to bring real change to New York and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Patrick Nelson’s story, click or tap here.

metafields.value: While our representatives argue about whether or not to raise the minimum wage, families are struggling to make rent. Dorothy Gasque is running for Congress in Washington’s 3rd district to reform our government and return power to the people rather than corporate interests Congress currently represents.
metafields.title: Website Blurb

metafields.value:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: Washington, 3rd District
Primary Date: 08/07/2018
Primary Type: Open; Non-Partisan (Jungle Primary)

”Politicians on both sides of the aisle pay lip service to the issues, but continue to pump out legislation that compound problems not ease them. ” - Dorothy Gasque

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Dorothy Gasque fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people she would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting to:

  • Medicare for all
  • Getting money out of politics
  • Decrease tax cuts on corporations stealing from working class people 
  • Criminal justice reform and combat institutional racism
  • Environmental protection and a renewable energy economy
  • Tuition-free public education 
  • Protecting the Bill of Rights for everyone


 Dorothy Gasque is a third generation public servant. She served eight years in the U.S. Army. In 2005 she deployed to Iraq, with an otherwise all male combat unit. Due to her rank as a non-commissioned officer, she was often asked to lead combat patrols, organize traffic checkpoints, and manage base security. In the spring of 2015, Dorothy joined in the efforts and began working to build the progressive movement in Clark County. She worked tirelessly to register voters and inform them about the caucus process. In her role as a community organizer, she developed and encouraged emergent leaders throughout the county to build a cohesive network of dynamic organizers and volunteers. As assistant director of the non-profit startup Concerned Humans Against Poverty (CHAP) Dorothy has organized dozens of volunteers that are making immediate positive changes for our houseless neighbors. Dorothy works to support other veterans and is the First Vice Chair of Washington State Veterans and Military Families Caucus.

”I saw a nation that jumps into conflict without compelling reason, and wastes precious resources and life in the process. While we waste trillions of dollars and human life on ill-conceived wars, our quality of life in the United States is drastically declining.” - Dorothy Gasque

Help us spread the message about Dorothy Gasque’s’ mission to bring real change to Washington and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Dorothy Gasque’s story,click or tap here.

NOTE: Turn off your popup blocker to use the JD dialer
(click on the name of your browser to see the full size animation)

Change before you log in: Safari, Edge
Change while you log in: Chrome, Firefox

4 Steps to Make Calls:
metafields.title: Calling Prompt

object.title: Dorothy Gasque Script

metafields.value:
Dorothy Gasque Phone Banking Script

Introduction:

Hello, my name is______ may I please speak with __________?

Hi _______, my name is _______and I’m a volunteer with the Dorothy Gasque for Congress campaign.

Dorothy is a progressive Democrat endorsed by Brand New Congress and Justice Democrats because she is fighting for: 

  • Medicare for all
  • Getting money out of politics
  • Decrease tax cuts on corporations stealing from working class people
  • Criminal justice reform and combat institutional racism
  • Environmental protection and a renewable energy economy
  • Tuition-free public education
  • Protecting the Bill of Rights for everyone

Can Dorothy count on your support and vote in the Washington Democratic primary for Congress in 2018?

(click on result to jump to the next script section)

1 - STRONG Gasque
2 - LEAN Gasque
3 - UNDECIDED
4 - LEAN Opponent
 5 - STRONG Opponent
6 - LEAN Other
7 - STRONG Other
8 - NOT VOTING

Support 1 - 2

That's great! We are on the same page. We are working hard to spread the message about Dorothy’s mission to bring real change to Washington’s 3rd District and to America. With only a few months left to organize, we need as much help as possible.

We are only going to win if we all stand up and help spread the word. Are you available to help make calls to voters just like I am doing right now?

If “yes” can volunteer: 

Awesome! Let me sign you up for an upcoming call shift! (go to jdems.us/call and sign them up for a call shift!).


Depending on your availability, you will select your available date(s), fill out this form with your information, and be sent a reminder before your scheduled call time via email and text message. A member from our dialer team will give you a call and make sure you feel ready.

If NO can't volunteer: 

It’s alright - if you find time in the future, please visit dorothyforcongress.com to get involved. You can also see everything we are doing on our facebook, twitter, and instagram.

Thank you for your time and support for Dorothy - we look forward to having you join us soon, [voter name].


(back to top)

Undecided/Lean Opponent 3 - 4

It’s alright, the election is just getting started so you will have plenty of opportunities to get to know Dorothy Gasque over the next few months.

Personally, I support Dorothy because _____________ (personal reason). What issues matter to you?

You can see more about Dorothy’s plans and the importance of this campaign on our website @ dorothyforcongress.com 

Thank you for your time, [voter name].

(back to top)

DO NOT Support 5 - 6 - 7 - 8

Thank you for your time, we hope we can win your support in the future, [voter name]!

(back to top)

Depending on your availability, you will select your available date(s), fill out this form with your information, and be sent a reminder before your scheduled call time via email and text message. A member from our dialer team will give you a call and make sure you feel ready.

If NO can't volunteer: 

It’s alright - if you find time in the future, please visit dorothyforcongress.com to get involved. You can also see everything we are doing on our facebook, twitter, and instagram.

Thank you for your time and support for Dorothy - we look forward to having you join us soon, [voter name].


(back to top)

Undecided/Lean Opponent 3 - 4

It’s alright, the election is just getting started so you will have plenty of opportunities to get to know Dorothy Gasque over the next few months.

Personally, I support Dorothy because _____________ . 

Personally I support Dorothy because she is a brave female veteran that is standing up to end wars of choice, and instead fight for a living wage for all, Medicare for All, and prosperity for All Americans."

What issues matter to you? (wait for response)

You can see more about Dorothy’s plans and the importance of this campaign on our website @ dorothyforcongress.com 

Thank you for your time, [voter name].

Thank you for your time, we hope we can win your support in the future, [voter name]!

metadata.website_blurb: While our representatives argue about whether or not to raise the minimum wage, families are struggling to make rent. Dorothy Gasque is running for Congress in Washington’s 3rd district to reform our government and return power to the people rather than corporate interests Congress currently represents.
