metadata.calling_prompt:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: Washington, 3rd District
Primary Date: 08/07/2018
Primary Type: Open; Non-Partisan (Jungle Primary)

”Politicians on both sides of the aisle pay lip service to the issues, but continue to pump out legislation that compound problems not ease them. ” - Dorothy Gasque

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Dorothy Gasque fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people she would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting to:

  • Medicare for all
  • Getting money out of politics
  • Decrease tax cuts on corporations stealing from working class people 
  • Criminal justice reform and combat institutional racism
  • Environmental protection and a renewable energy economy
  • Tuition-free public education 
  • Protecting the Bill of Rights for everyone


 Dorothy Gasque is a third generation public servant. She served eight years in the U.S. Army. In 2005 she deployed to Iraq, with an otherwise all male combat unit. Due to her rank as a non-commissioned officer, she was often asked to lead combat patrols, organize traffic checkpoints, and manage base security. In the spring of 2015, Dorothy joined in the efforts and began working to build the progressive movement in Clark County. She worked tirelessly to register voters and inform them about the caucus process. In her role as a community organizer, she developed and encouraged emergent leaders throughout the county to build a cohesive network of dynamic organizers and volunteers. As assistant director of the non-profit startup Concerned Humans Against Poverty (CHAP) Dorothy has organized dozens of volunteers that are making immediate positive changes for our houseless neighbors. Dorothy works to support other veterans and is the First Vice Chair of Washington State Veterans and Military Families Caucus.

”I saw a nation that jumps into conflict without compelling reason, and wastes precious resources and life in the process. While we waste trillions of dollars and human life on ill-conceived wars, our quality of life in the United States is drastically declining.” - Dorothy Gasque

Help us spread the message about Dorothy Gasque’s’ mission to bring real change to Washington and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Dorothy Gasque’s story,click or tap here.

NOTE: Turn off your popup blocker to use the JD dialer
(click on the name of your browser to see the full size animation)

Change before you log in: Safari, Edge
Change while you log in: Chrome, Firefox

4 Steps to Make Calls:

metafields.value: Ammar Campa-Najjar is an entrepreneur and former federal official who was born and raised in San Diego, California. He lived in Gaza where he witnessed war, emboldening him to be a staunch advocate of peace and combatting economic injustice. His platform includes a $21 billion investment in apprenticeship jobs, Medicare for all, passing a clean Dream Act, investing in renewable energy, and overturning Citizens United.
metafields.title: Website Blurb

metadata.website_blurb: Ammar Campa-Najjar is an entrepreneur and former federal official who was born and raised in San Diego, California. He lived in Gaza where he witnessed war, emboldening him to be a staunch advocate of peace and combatting economic injustice. His platform includes a $21 billion investment in apprenticeship jobs, Medicare for all, passing a clean Dream Act, investing in renewable energy, and overturning Citizens United.

metafields.value: As a representative in Congress for California’s 49th district, Colonel Doug Applegate will reject political brinkmanship and focus on a progressive vision that advances our economy, champion union jobs and apprenticeships, fight for our troops and veterans, protect our environment including our coastal habitats, and stand up for our values as American people.
metafields.title: Website Blurb

metafields.value:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: California, District 49
Primary Date: 06/05/2018
Primary Type: Top Two

”As a civil rights attorney, I have watched our criminal justice system fail countless Americans and disproportionately target people of color. The United States has the highest incarceration rate in the world. With little emphasis on rehabilitation, minor drug offenses lead to a vicious cycle of recidivism. It is time to find alternatives to our current criminal justice policies and work toward a more just, equitable system that truly reduces crime and keeps our communities safe.” - Doug Applegate

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Doug fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people he would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting for:

  • Single-payer healthcare for all
  • Reproductive rights for women
  • Criminal justice reform
  • Ending oil subsidies to free market forces to deliver 100% renewable energy by 2027
  • Access to healthcare for everyone
  • Comprehensive immigration reform and DACA
  • Strengthen the VA, social security, and medicare
  • Amend the Second Amendment with safety and gun violence prevention standards
  • Campaign finance reform

Doug Applegate has a proven record spanning four decades as a Marine Colonel serving around the world and as a civilian trial attorney. He grew up in a hardworking, middle-class, blue-collar family and was the first Applegate to graduate from college. In 2006, he retired from the Marine Corps having served 32 years. He has lived and worked in the 49th Congressional District since 1981 when he was first stationed at Camp Pendleton while serving. He believes that we need new, positive leadership committed to integrity, accountability, and transparency in order to create a Congress that will remove from government the influence of big money. He is focused on bipartisan measures that advance our economy, champion union jobs and apprenticeships, fight for our troops and veterans, protect our environment including our coastal habitats, and stand up for our values as American people for all people.

”True patriotism is about serving our country in any way we can. Our duty as citizens is to keep America strong and working for all of us. Too many people today believe that playing by the rules and working hard are not enough to give the next generation the chance to get ahead. I will fight to give all hard-working Americans an opportunity to succeed.” - Doug Applegate

Help us spread the message about Doug’s mission to bring real change to California’s 49th District and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Doug Applegate’s story, click or tap here.

metafields.value: Lorie Burch has dedicated her career as a lawyer to fighting for vulnerable communities and ensuring equal rights for all. Now, Lorie is running for Congress in the 3rd District of Texas to continue that critical work in Washington. Lorie’s work as an LGBTQ+ activist has proven her dedication and commitment to equality, and we can’t wait to see what she will accomplish in Congress.

metafields.value: Today’s Republican leadership has strayed far from their roots: Empowering people to live their lives freely and on their own terms, controlling costs and spending wisely, being good stewards of our national resources, lifting up our neighbors when they are in need -- and most importantly, having the integrity to be accountable for our actions.
metafields.title: Short Story

metafields.value:
VOTING INFORMATION 

District: AR-03

Primary Date: May 2018

Primary Type: Open

Robb Ryerse has been a minister for over 20 years. Today he co-pastors Vintage Fellowship, nestled in Northwest Arkansas, with his wife Vanessa. Vintage Fellowship is a radically different kind of church that welcomes all people and is a member of OPEN, a network of progressive-leaning churches. Robb is an Eisenhower Republican who wants to help lead the party back to their roots of responsible stewardship, personal liberty and equal opportunity for all -- qualities he finds lacking in today’s Republican leadership. After serving his Arkansas community as pastor for the last 12 years, Robb is answering a different call today: The call to run for United States Congress, bringing integrity and compassion back to the halls of government. 

 “Congressman Womack has never faced a primary challenge. The last three elections, the Democrats haven’t even run against him. In our district, it’s not a 2-party system, it’s a 1-party system. I’m running because Arkansans need a choice. They need an alternative to a rubber stamp for the administration, and a rubber stamp for the establishment… What Arkansans need is less shenanigans and party politics, and more principled leadership that’s about a positive vision for what we can do together in this country to make a more just and generous society for all Americans.” - Robb Ryerse

As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, he fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people he would represent by replacing the incumbent:   

  • Enact meaningful tax reform
  • End generational poverty
  • Provide healthcare access for all to protect the sanctity of human life
  • Revive public service
  • Ensure the right for everyone to live the American Dream

When he says Arkansas' Third District needs new leadership, everyone listening knows he's right - to us, his supporters, it's obvious this leadership should be Robb. Brand New Congress is proud of supporting candidates like Robb with a positive vision for our future. 

Help us spread the message about Robb Ryerse's mission to bring real change to Arkansas and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Robb’s story, click or tap here.

metafields.value: Born and raised in Lancaster County, Pennsylvania, Jess King is working mom running for Congress in PA’s 11th District. Jess is focused on passing Medicare-for-All and building an America that belongs to all of us, not just the wealthiest and well-connected in Washington.
metafields.title: Website Blurb

metafields.value:
VOTING INFORMATION 

District: PA-11
Primary Date: 5/15/2018
Primary Type: Party members only
Early Voting: Not Permitted
Voter Registration Deadline: 4/16/2018

“So many of us are working our hearts out to make ends meet, but still struggling to get ahead. Meanwhile the political establishment in Washington rigs the game for the rich and the powerful. We have the opportunity right now and the political will right here to play a different game. We can build an America that puts families first. We can rewrite the rules so our economy works for all of us, no matter our zip code or our income.” - Jess King

Justice Democrats is proud of supporting candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Jess King fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people she would represent by replacing the incumbent: 

  • Debt-free college tuition: because quality education is a right
  • Medicare for All: because healthcare is a human right
  • Opposing the Atlantic Sunrise pipeline: because there should be no eminent domain for corporate gain
  • Raising the minimum wage: because no one working 40 hours a week should struggle to make a living

Jess King is a working mom, small business champion, and a leader in local economic development. She never planned on running for office but after a career fighting for working families in Pennsylvania, she joined the race for the 16th District because too many of us are working hard for too little while a greedy few rig the game in Washington. Her leadership has been recognized with “Jessica King Day in the City of Pittsburgh,” Pittsburgh’s 40 under 40, Lancaster’s Ethics in Business Award, the Red Rose Award, and the Friend of Workforce Award and Baldwin Fellowship. She is a current Local Economy Fellow with the national Business Alliance for Local Living Economies. She served as a Commissioner on Lancaster Mayor Rick Gray’s Commission to Combat Poverty, and spearheads the Coalition to Combat Poverty’s Private Sector Working Group.

Help us spread the message about Jess King's mission to bring real change to Pennsylvania District-11 and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Jess King’s story, click or tap here.

metafields.value:
Jess King Phone Banking Script

Introduction:

Hi, is [voter name] available?

Hi [voter name], my name is ____ and I’m volunteering with the Jess King for Congress campaign. How are you?

Have you heard of Jess King before?

If No: Jess is a working mom from Lancaster City. On Monday, Pennsylvania adopted new congressional district lines. Our district is now known as PA-11, which includes all of Lancaster County and southern York County. Most of us are working harder than ever to make ends meet but we're still falling behind. Meanwhile, the wealthiest Americans have stacked the deck against ordinary people. I feel that we all have a choice to make. Are we going to sit back and allow the rich and powerful to rewrite the laws to favor themselves? OR will we decide to build an America that works for all of us, no matter who we are or how much money we make. We at the Jess King campaign have decided that enough is enough. We are running a bold campaign to stand up for the working families of central Pennsylvania in the US Congress. 

If Yes: Wonderful! (move on to supporter question)

Can we count on you to join the movement, and vote for Jess King in the Democratic Primary on May 15th?

(click on result to jump to the next script section)

1 - STRONG King
2 - LEAN King
3 - UNDECIDED
4 - LEAN Opponent
 5 - STRONG Opponent
6 - LEAN Other
7 - STRONG Other
8 - NOT VOTING

Support 1 - 2

Thanks for your support. We’re not an establishment campaign. We’re building this movement the old-school, grassroots way - talking to voters person to person and showing our support publicly.

Will you volunteer for the campaign or put up a yard sign to show your support?

If “yes” can volunteer or want a yard sign: Awesome! Let me sign you up to volunteer / receive a yard sign! (go to Click here to submit volunteer or yard sign request - fill out the form) Great, we’ll deliver that to you and be in touch soon!

If “no” cannot volunteer: Okay, please visit JessKingforCongress.com if you find time in the future to get involved!

Thank you for supporting, Jess! Have a great night. [voter name].

Undecided/Lean Opponent 3 - 4

OK! Jess believes in standing up for policies that will make America work for all of us. She supports:

  • Medicare for All: because healthcare is a human right
  • Debt-free college tuition: because quality education is a right.
  • Raising the minimum wage: because no one working 40 hours a week should struggle to make a living
  • Opposing the Atlantic Sunrise pipeline: because there should be no eminent domain for corporate gain

With that in mind, can Jess count on your support this May?

(wait for response - If yes, canvass as 2 - Lean King)

Okay, thank you! Have a great night.

DO NOT Support 5 - 6 - 7 - 8

Okay! We hope that we can earn your support on election day. Have a great night!

She has spent 20 years in the classroom and 16 years as the pastor of a local congregation. Mary is passionate about caring for people, building community, and bringing people together.

Mary is a fierce advocate for social justice, as a pastor and as an educator. She has spent 20 years in the classroom and 16 years as the pastor of a local congregation. Mary is passionate about caring for people, building community, and bringing people together.

metafields.value: A congressperson represents their people—at least, they’re supposed to. Congress today works to protect the bottom line of powerful multinational corporations, not people like us. My circumstances, my sentiments and my values are shared all around me in the 9th District. I believe I am the person who can represent the loud, resistant, beacon of social change that is the 9th. I will fight for social and economic change against a system rigged for normal people like us to fail.
metafields.title: Short Story

metafields.value:
VOTING INFORMATION 

District: WA-09
Primary Date: 8/7/2018
Primary Type: Open; non-partisan “top two” advance
Early Voting: Mail-In
Voter Registration Deadline: 7/6/2018

“A congressperson represents their people -- at least, they’re supposed to. Congress today works to protect the bottom line of powerful multinational corporations, not people like us.” -Sarah Smith 

Justice Democrats is proud of supporting candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Sarah Smith fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people she would represent by replacing the incumbent: 

  • Investing in new industries with a living wage
  • Making education accessible with tuition free public college and trade school
  • Fighting for Medicare for All
  • Ending the War on Drugs and the School to Prison pipeline
  • Leading the Green Energy revolution

Raised in a proud working class family, her parents taught her hard work can overcome seemingly impossible odds, yet her family was hit hard by the Great Recession and was forced to split up to survive. Sarah knows she’s not alone.

“The importance of doing the right thing and standing up for our values was drilled into me my entire life. I felt those values calling me to serve as I’d never served before, and I embraced it. I’m running for Congress because I believe it’s time for regular people to be represented by regular people. Congress can only serve America when it stands as a true reflection of Americans -- the full spectrum of our society.” -Sarah Smith

Help us spread the message about Sarah's mission to bring real change to Washington District-09 and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Sarah Smith’s story, click or tap here.

object.title: Sarah Smith Script

metafields.value:
Sarah Smith Phone Banking Script

Introduction:

Hello, my name is______ may I please speak with __________?

Hi _______, my name is _______and I’m a volunteer with the Sarah Smith for Congress campaign.

Sarah is a progressive Democrat endorsed by Brand New Congress because she is fighting to:

  • Invest in new industries with a living wages
  • Make education accessible with tuition free public college and trade school
  • Fight for Medicare for All
  • End the War on Drugs and the School to Prison pipeline
  • Lead the Green Energy revolution

Can Sarah count on your support and vote in Washington's Democratic primary for Congress in 2018?

(click on result to jump to the next script section)

1 - STRONG Sarah
2 - LEAN Sarah 
3 - UNDECIDED
4 - LEAN Opponent
 5 - STRONG Opponent
6 - LEAN Other
7 - STRONG Other
8 - NOT VOTING

Support 1 - 2

That's great! We are on the same page. We are working hard to spread the message about Sarah’s mission to bring real change to Washington's 9th and to America. With only a few months left to organize, we need as much help as possible.

We are only going to win if we all stand up and help spread the word. Will you help make calls to voters just like I am doing right now? We will provide you guides, training, and live support to make sure you have a great experience and make a real difference in these congressional races, no matter your location or ability. All you’ll need is a laptop, microphone headphones/headset, and wifi. 

If “yes” can volunteer: Awesome! Let me sign you up for an upcoming call shift! (go to jdems.us/call and sign them up for a call shift!). 

Depending on your availability, you will select your available date(s), fill out this form with your information, and be sent a reminder before your scheduled call time via email and text message. A member from our dialer team will give you a call and make sure you feel ready. 

Depending on your availability, you will select your available date(s), fill out this form with your information, and be sent a reminder before your scheduled call time via email and text message. A member from our dialer team will give you a call and make sure you feel ready. 

If “no” cannot volunteer It’s alright - if you find time in the future, please visit votesarahsmith.com to get involved or visit events.justicedemocrats.com to find an event near you!

Thank you for your time and support for Sarah - we look forward to having you join us soon, [voter name].

Undecided/Lean Opponent 3 - 4

It’s alright, our campaign is just getting started so you will have plenty of opportunities to get to know Sarah Smith over the next few months.

Personally, I support Sarah because _____________ 

Sample Text: Sarah is the middle of three daughters, born to hardworking, compassionate parents who sacrificed everything for their daughters to have a good lives. Unfortunately, they were hit hard by the Great Recession. Her dad was forced to retire and to sell her family’s home. Her close, loving family split in different directions to survive. She worked her way through college, staring down vanishing job opportunities and mounting student debt. She learned that you can’t always pull yourself ahead through hard work alone. She was lucky enough to have friends who were able to put a roof over her head when things got especially difficult.

You can see more about Sarah’s plans and the importance of this campaign on our website @ votesarahsmith.com

Thank you for your time, [voter name].

(back to top)

DO NOT Support 5 - 6 - 7 - 8

Thank you for your time, we hope we can win your support in the future, [voter name]!

(back to top)

metadata.website_blurb: A congressperson represents their people -- at least, they’re supposed to. Congress today works to protect the bottom line of powerful multinational corporations, not people like us...
metadata.short_story: A congressperson represents their people—at least, they’re supposed to. Congress today works to protect the bottom line of powerful multinational corporations, not people like us. My circumstances, my sentiments and my values are shared all around me in the 9th District. I believe I am the person who can represent the loud, resistant, beacon of social change that is the 9th. I will fight for social and economic change against a system rigged for normal people like us to fail.

metadata.calling_prompt:
VOTING INFORMATION 

District: WA-09
Primary Date: 8/7/2018
Primary Type: Open; non-partisan “top two” advance
Early Voting: Mail-In
Voter Registration Deadline: 7/6/2018

“A congressperson represents their people -- at least, they’re supposed to. Congress today works to protect the bottom line of powerful multinational corporations, not people like us.” -Sarah Smith 

Justice Democrats is proud of supporting candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Sarah Smith fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people she would represent by replacing the incumbent: 

  • Investing in new industries with a living wage
  • Making education accessible with tuition free public college and trade school
  • Fighting for Medicare for All
  • Ending the War on Drugs and the School to Prison pipeline
  • Leading the Green Energy revolution

Raised in a proud working class family, her parents taught her hard work can overcome seemingly impossible odds, yet her family was hit hard by the Great Recession and was forced to split up to survive. Sarah knows she’s not alone.

“The importance of doing the right thing and standing up for our values was drilled into me my entire life. I felt those values calling me to serve as I’d never served before, and I embraced it. I’m running for Congress because I believe it’s time for regular people to be represented by regular people. Congress can only serve America when it stands as a true reflection of Americans -- the full spectrum of our society.” -Sarah Smith

Help us spread the message about Sarah's mission to bring real change to Washington District-09 and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Sarah Smith’s story, click or tap here.

metafields.value: Bryan Caforio has spent his career taking on big banks, insurance companies, and corporations that have screwed people over since the financial collapse. He's seen firsthand a system rigged against consumers and working families because career politicians have written the rules to let the corporate special interests get richer at the expense of everyone else. It’s time we rip up those old rules and create a new system where special interests can’t take advantage of hard working Americans.
metafields.title: Website Blurb

metafields.value:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: California, 25th District
Primary Date:  5/19/2018
Primary Type: Open

”Now more than ever, Congress must use its power to create jobs, help middle-class Americans get ahead and make the wealthiest pay their fair share, protect our healthcare, safeguard environmental protections, defend against discrimination, and ensure our freedom.” - Bryan Caforio

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Bryan Caforio fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people she would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting to:

  • Supporting women in reproductive rights, equal pay, and health 
  • Defending Medicare and Social Security 
  • Building an economy that works for the middle class 
  • Investing into small businesses over big corporations
  • Preserving and protecting our environment 
  • Fixing our immigration system, securing our border
  • Defending DACA and California DREAM Act
  • Passing legislation for gun violence prevention 
  • Enacting campaign finance reform 

Bryan is running for Congress to fight for middle-class families, women, children, and seniors. Growing up in a house with two public school teachers, Bryan learned the value of hard work and the benefits that come from a great public education. Bryan attended public schools his whole life and earned an academic scholarship to UCLA. He then took out student loans to attend Yale Law School, where he represented tenants who were being taken advantage of by unscrupulous landlords. After graduating, Bryan started his career by going into public service and working for a United States federal judge on the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals, giving him firsthand experience with our broken immigration and criminal justice systems. For the last eight years, Bryan has practiced as an attorney in Southern California taking on big banks, insurance companies, and corporations for screwing people over since the financial collapse. Throughout his career, Bryan has seen a system in which far too many banks and corporations take advantage of the people they’re supposed to serve – either because they know they won’t get caught, or, even worse, because career politicians have written the rules to let corporate special interests get richer at the expense of the middle class. Bryan is running for Congress because it’s time we rip up the old rules, reign in the corporate special interests, and build a new system where hard-working Americans come first. 

”Unless we dramatically reform our political system, insurance companies will continue to control our health care, oil companies will continue to dictate how we respond to climate change, and corporations will continue to get massive tax breaks for shipping jobs overseas… I strongly support a constitutional amendment to overturn Citizens United, and I will fight for publicly financed elections, eliminating money from politics, and complete transparency for all political contributions.” - Bryan Caforio

Help us spread the message about Bryan Caforio’s mission to bring real change to California and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Bryan Caforio’s story, click or tap here.
metafields.title: Calling Prompt

metafields.value:
Bryan Caforio Phone Banking Script

Introduction:

Hi, may I speak with __________? My name is __________; I’m volunteering with the Bryan Caforio campaign. How are you today? (acknowledge answer)

Bryan is the Democrat running for Congress here. I support Bryan because he has a history of fighting for our community. Bryan’s a former federal law clerk who has the skills and experience necessary to hold Trump accountable when Trump breaks the law.

Can we count on you to support Bryan Caforio, the Democrat running for Congress, this June?

(click on result to jump to the next script section)

1 - STRONG Caforio
2 - LEAN Caforio
3 - UNDECIDED
4 - LEAN Opponent
 5 - STRONG Opponent
6 - LEAN Other
7 - STRONG Other
8 - NOT VOTING

Support 1 - 2

This election will be close, and Republicans have already spent millions of dollars in this race. Because of that, our grassroots volunteers are knocking on doors and making calls to talk to every voter in our area.Can we count on you to join us?

If YES, can volunteer: Great! We have two different locations to volunteer in: 

  • Antelope Valley - Our supporters help out Tuesday, Thursday and Sunday: 10am, 1pm, 5pm and 7pm. We are located at: 650 C Commerce Ave, Palmdale CA 93551
  • Santa Clarita/Simi Valley/ Porter Ranch - Our supporters help out Monday through Sunday from: 10am, 1pm, 5pm and 7pm. We are located at: 25835 Railroad Ave, unit #23, Santa Clarita, CA 91350

Which day and time works best for you? (Repeat two locations again if needed - then fill out form below)

If NO, can't volunteer: No worries! (move on to next part of the script)

We are doing a lot of things until the election and we would love to keep you updated! Can I send you a text with links to our website or social media so you can give us a like or follow?

If YES: Great! (click on button below and fill out form for them)

If NO: Alright - if you find time in the future, please visit bryancaforio.com to get involved.

Thank you for your time and support for Bryan - we look forward to having you join us soon, [voter name].

Undecided/Lean Opponent 3 - 4

I'm glad you're supporting Democrats. What issue is most important to you? (Listen to their concern and mark as Undecided - [issue] in desktop window)

Healthcare

Trump

Social Security

Immigration

I understand. I’m supporting Bryan because he will: (pick a few points that are important to you)

metadata.website_blurb: Bryan Caforio has spent his career taking on big banks, insurance companies, and corporations that have screwed people over since the financial collapse. He's seen firsthand a system rigged against consumers and working families because career politicians have written the rules to let the corporate special interests get richer at the expense of everyone else. It’s time we rip up those old rules and create a new system where special interests can’t take advantage of hard working Americans.

metadata.calling_prompt:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: California, 25th District
Primary Date:  5/19/2018
Primary Type: Open

”Now more than ever, Congress must use its power to create jobs, help middle-class Americans get ahead and make the wealthiest pay their fair share, protect our healthcare, safeguard environmental protections, defend against discrimination, and ensure our freedom.” - Bryan Caforio

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Bryan Caforio fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people she would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting to:

  • Supporting women in reproductive rights, equal pay, and health 
  • Defending Medicare and Social Security 
  • Building an economy that works for the middle class 
  • Investing into small businesses over big corporations
  • Preserving and protecting our environment 
  • Fixing our immigration system, securing our border
  • Defending DACA and California DREAM Act
  • Passing legislation for gun violence prevention 
  • Enacting campaign finance reform 

Bryan is running for Congress to fight for middle-class families, women, children, and seniors. Growing up in a house with two public school teachers, Bryan learned the value of hard work and the benefits that come from a great public education. Bryan attended public schools his whole life and earned an academic scholarship to UCLA. He then took out student loans to attend Yale Law School, where he represented tenants who were being taken advantage of by unscrupulous landlords. After graduating, Bryan started his career by going into public service and working for a United States federal judge on the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals, giving him firsthand experience with our broken immigration and criminal justice systems. For the last eight years, Bryan has practiced as an attorney in Southern California taking on big banks, insurance companies, and corporations for screwing people over since the financial collapse. Throughout his career, Bryan has seen a system in which far too many banks and corporations take advantage of the people they’re supposed to serve – either because they know they won’t get caught, or, even worse, because career politicians have written the rules to let corporate special interests get richer at the expense of the middle class. Bryan is running for Congress because it’s time we rip up the old rules, reign in the corporate special interests, and build a new system where hard-working Americans come first. 

”Unless we dramatically reform our political system, insurance companies will continue to control our health care, oil companies will continue to dictate how we respond to climate change, and corporations will continue to get massive tax breaks for shipping jobs overseas… I strongly support a constitutional amendment to overturn Citizens United, and I will fight for publicly financed elections, eliminating money from politics, and complete transparency for all political contributions.” - Bryan Caforio

Help us spread the message about Bryan Caforio’s mission to bring real change to California and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Bryan Caforio’s story, click or tap here.

metafields.value: Join me in creating a Brand New Congress
metafields.title: Signup Prompt

metafields.value: Texas has one of the most robust economies in the country -- even the world. There’s no reason the 14th shouldn’t be an economic leader. Health care, a good education, and the opportunity to succeed; that’s what people deserve and it’s what Adrienne Bell will fight for as your Representative.
metafields.title: Short Story

metafields.value:
VOTING INFORMATION

District: Texas, 14th District
Primary Date: 03/06/2018
Primary Type: Party Members and Unaffiliated

”I believe education is how we bring opportunity within anyone’s grasp – and my life has proven it. But there are other obstacles now, and things are different for working families today than when I came up... When I look around our district, I see a lot of people hurting, but I also see tremendous possibility.” - Adrienne Bell

Justice Democrats is proud to support candidates with a positive vision for our future. As establishment strategies continue to fail the people, Adrienne fights for a platform to uplift the lives of the extraordinary people she would represent by replacing the incumbent and fighting to:

  • Ensure divide between police and community ends by demilitarizing police 
  • Combat job crisis by incentivizing local hiring and supporting small business
  • Ensure the public schools receive adequate funding
  • Fund vocational programs and technical schools
  • End the war on drugs and remove mandatory minimum sentences

As a native Houstonian, Adrienne has witnessed the decline in opportunity for working-class families. She is currently an educator with the largest school district in Texas. She has spent years in education and understands the positive impact reinvestment in education would have in the district. Adrienne wants to wield the power of government to help regular people – to be a voice for the people ignored in our current political climate. She has served as a Deputy Field Director with Battleground Texas/Wendy Davis for Governor, and on the Houston staff for the Obama 2012 election campaign. She has plans for new investments through federal grants to revitalize the port cities, rebuild infrastructure, and create green jobs across the district. Texas has one of the most robust economies in the country and there’s no reason the 14th shouldn’t also be an economic leader. She will push legislation to secure equity in education, because she believes an education should not be based on a student's zip code. She believes in a woman’s right to choose, and will fight for criminal justice reform. Adrienne believes everyone deserves healthcare, a good education, and the opportunity to succeed. That’s what she will fight for as your representative. 

”But at the end of the day, you can’t work if you’re sick and can’t afford treatment. That’s why I believe healthcare is a human right. I know Texas is ready for single payer even if Rep. Randy Weber doesn’t agree. Weber joined his Republican colleagues in voting for American Health Care Act, but I’m watching these town halls and I’m talking to voters in our area. I see Republicans and Democrats alike demanding better options.” - Adrienne Bell

Help us spread the message about Adrienne Bell’s mission to bring real change to California and to America and make some calls! 

To read the rest of Adrienne Bell’s story, click or tap here.
